loans.use: to pay her children’s schooling expenses

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, 35, is married and a mother of six children. She has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price. For this reason, she has many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough money to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she is requesting a RS 35,000 loan to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. This will allow her to consistently meet the increasing demand for the products. She will utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour to sell at her store

loans.name: Zakarias

texts.en:
Zakarias, 38, is married to Yetti, 34. They are blessed with one daughter, Yetty. Yetty is ten years old and is currently in fourth grade.

Zakarias has been a farmer for years. The job allows him to earn income to finance his household's needs. He cultivates a paddy during the rainy season and grows vegetables, such as corn, tomatoes, and cucumbers, in the summer. 

Zakarias plans to plant more vegetables but needs additional money to buy seedlings and fertilizer. He also dreams of starting a poultry business. Therefore, he is requesting a loan from TLM for IDR 10,000,000. This loan would enable him to build chicken stalls as well as buy two boxes of chicks and fodder. Zakarias is hoping that TLM will provide him with a loan so he can improve his business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, chicks, fodder, and chicken wire

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah was born in 1962. She is married and has six children. Her husband is retired. She has been selling clothes at her own store since having her third child. 

She started her business at home, then opened her own store to raise her profits and help cover her children’s needs. 

With this loan, she will buy new clothes to sell. She plans to add products in the future.

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Michael Gonzalo

texts.es: El joven Michael, de 29 años de edad es soltero estudiante de la carrera de Ing. Civil, trabaja como técnico para una institución estatal, medio con el que se apoya para pagar sus estudios universitarios, los cuales está por culminar y para tal fin solicita el crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación, por el que tiene mucha ilusión para verse como todo un profesional y salir adelante en la vida con sus esfuerzos, para ayudar a los demas dentro de sus posibilidades.
texts.en: The young man Michael is a 29-year-old, single student who studies Civil Engineering.  He works as a technician for a state institution. This is the means by which he pays for his education, which he is about to complete. For this reason he requests a loan to pay for his completion course. He is very excited to look like a professional and through his effort get ahead in life so that he can help others within his means.

loans.use: to pay for a completion course

loans.name: Sotero

texts.es: Con un crédito que obtuvo el año pasado por parte de Kiva a Sotero le fue posible comprar fertilizante y hacer labores de limpieza en su finca y gracias a esto obtuvo una muy buena producción de café, el cual entregó en su totalidad a la “Unión de Huatusco”. Para esta nueva cosecha Sotero necesita otro crédito porque con el comprará nueva planta de café y realizará labores de limpieza en su terreno para que de esta manera siga produciendo café de la más alta calidad.
texts.en:
With a loan that he obtained last year through Kiva, Sotero was able to buy fertilizer and cleanup his farm. Thanks to the assistance he got a very good production of coffee, which gave entirely to the “Unión de Huatusco” (Union of Huatusco). 

For this new harvest Sotero needs another loan to purchase a new coffee plant and perform cleanup on the grounds  in order to continue producing coffee of the highest quality.

loans.use: to purchase a plant and clean his land

loans.name: Salmate

texts.en:
Salmate is a 29-year-old married woman. With the support of her husband, she has been in the business of selling crockery for many years. She sells a  variety of crockery, such as glasses, dinner sets, tea sets, and bowls. Her husband assists her in selling the products to people in their community and at the local market. 

Salmate makes a sufficient amount of money to contribute to her family's income. To improve her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of RS 25,000. Salmate will use a loan to purchase a variety of crockery, including tea sets, bowls, and glasses. She expects that the loan will boost her earnings. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of crockery, including tea sets, bowls and glasses

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson, a 44-year-old married woman from Jenin city, is a mother of six children: three boys and three girls. She lives in a humble house in the city with her husband and children.

Mayson's husband is a worker outside Jenin city, Because his ability to go to work every day is inhibited by the checkpoint between his city and where he works, his income is unstable and he often faces daily challenges in his effort to make a living.

Mayson and her husband would like to improve their home by buying necessary home appliances, including a new refrigerator since the old one can't be fixed. She has therefore requested a USD loan from FATEN to help her buy them. This loan will improve the family's living conditions. .

loans.use: to buy needed home appliances

loans.name: Calixta

texts.es: Calixta, de 55 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijo al que cuida en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Calixta se dedica es la venta de verduras, hortalizas y papa en el mercado de la zona, además trabaja en la gobernación de su localidad en limpieza pública recibiendo un sueldo mensual. Al inicio trabajaba todos los días en la venta de verduras, pero ahora ya no tiene las mismas fuerzas de antes y solo trabaja tres veces por semana “el negocio es muy bueno y tengo clientes, por lo que no me retiro por completo”, afirma. Ahora tiene pensando abrir una pequeña tienda en su casa donde pueda vender los diversos productos.Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo recibido. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Calixta, invertirá los S/.400 soles en la compra de verduras y tubérculos al por mayor para su venta.
texts.en:
Calixta who is 55-years-old is a simple woman. She lives with her husband and son who she takes care of in the house that she bought a few years ago. Calixta sells vegetables, garden produce, and potatoes in the market in her area. She also works in her local governance in public sanitation receiving a monthly salary. Initially, she worked every day selling vegetables, but now she does not have the same strength as before and only works three days a week. "Business is very good and I have clients, so I do not stop working entirely," she affirms. She is now thinking of opening a small shop in her home where she can sell the various products. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the support received. Also, she promises to be timely with their payments. Calixta, invest the 400 soles in buying wholesale vegetables and potatoes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale vegetables and potatoes

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Getrude, who was born in 1956 in Nyakaina Buyanja, is a married mother of five. She is a farmer and carries out a goat trade as her major source of income. She joined UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) in 2009 when she was starting her business.

Getrude, who is currently constructing her residential home, is now requesting a loan to finish the task. The client praises UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial assistance it extends to low income earners, assistance that has helped improve the living standards of many low income earners.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Awadallah

texts.en:
Awadallah is a 39-year-old married man. He lives in Gaza City with his wife and five children: two boys and three girls. All of them are under 18. 

Awadallah works as an employee in a local ministry and he gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family's needs, so Awadallah opened a small supermarket in the city. It is a profitable business since it is the only one in that area, but it still needs some development. 

Awadallah took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more needed stock for his supermarket like dairy milk, sugar and other consumer goods to resell them. This will improve Awadallah's store and increase his income.

Awadallah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more needed stock for his supermarket like dairy milk, sugar and other consumer goods

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 43 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos en la casa que heredó de su madre. Durante los primeros días de la semana se dedica al trabajo de limpieza pública en su gobernación, donde le pagan un sueldo mensual, pero la actividad económica que desarrolla por muchos años es la crianza de animales menores como ovejas, cerdos y gallinas. Al comienzo vivía en el pueblo de su madre, donde tenía el espacio suficiente para criar, pero con el tiempo se trasladó a la ciudad para mejorar su condición de vida, gracias a este negocio pudo construir la casa donde hoy educa a su hijos, por lo que nunca dejó de dedicarse a la venta de animales, ahora todos los fines de semana se dedica por completo al cuidado de ellos y una vez al mes los comercializa, obteniendo más ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Alejandrina, invertirá S/.500 soles en la compra de ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, is a hardworking, 43-year-old woman.  She lives alongside her two children in the house she inherited from her mother.  During the first days of the week, she makes a living by working in public cleaning services for her government.  They pay her a monthly salary, but the economic activity she has developed for many years has been raising young animals such as sheep, pigs, and hens.

At first she lived in her mother's town, where she had sufficient space to raise the animals, but over time she moved to the city to improve her living conditions.  Thanks to this business, she could construct the house where today she educates her children.  Because she never stopped making a living by selling animals, she now completely dedicates all weekends to caring for them.  Once a month she makes a profit by selling them.  

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives in order to move forward.  Alejandrina will invest S/.500 soles by purchasing sheep to increase her herd.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: 2 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “2 DE JULIO”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martha es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chuño, costura de pantalones, venta de comida, taller de costura, tejido de mantas, venta de ollas a presión, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martha es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas de grupo que son socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chuño (papa deshidratada); da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa de su madre quien le guío en el manejo de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chuño) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de las cominidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "2 de Julio" is starting its 3rd loan cycle in the Senkata office of Pro Mujer.  This group has 8 members and is led by a board of directors where Martha is the president.  The members of this group have a variety of businesses, including: selling freeze-dried potatoes, selling pants, selling food, dressmaking, weaving blankets, selling pressure cookers, and selling vegetables.

The loan that they are taking will benefit all of the small-businesswomen in the group in which Martha is a member.  She says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined at the invitation of her friends, who are in the group and who are members of the institution.  Now Martha has a business selling freeze-dried potatoes.  She came to know this business because her mother taught her how to handle this product.  

The loan that Martha is taking now will be used to increase her capital (purchase freeze-dried potatoes).  She will buy the potatoes from the wholesalers in the communities in the department of La Paz to later sell from her stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the loans and the savings accounts.

loans.use: to buy freeze-dried potatoes

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz María mayor de edad, originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega, zona donde se encuentran establecidas dos de las más grandes empresas en Nicaragua: una azucarera, y la otra licorera, Luz se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pastes realizados por ella misma, negocio que lo inicia con fondos propios donde ya son varios años de experiencias y muchos conocen de su trabajo, de su calidad, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honesta y atenta con sus clientes, ella inicia su jornada de trabajo desde muy temprano, para no quedar mal con sus clientes, los cuales ella está muy al pendiente de lo que ellos solicitan, el objetivo de este crédito es para la compra de materiales como: telas, hilos, esponjas, agujas, para la producción de estos hermosos pastes que ella entrega a sus clientes los cuales tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, sus compras las realiza en mercados de mayoreos al contado. Luz está muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Luz María is an adult and originally from one of the towns in Chinandega, an area where two of Nicaragua's largest companies operate: one is a sugar plant, while the other business produces liquor.  Luz makes a living producing and selling bath scrubbers.  She started this business with her own money and she now has a number of years of experience.  Many people know Luz because of her work and the quality of her work.  Luz is hard-working, honest, and courteous with her customers.  She starts work very early so as not to have problems with her customers.  Luz is very attentive to her customers' wants.  Luz will use this loan to buy materials, such as thread, material, sponges, and more, for making these wonderful back scrubbers.  She will sell these to her customers, some of whom are regulars, and some of whom are just one-time customers.  Luz makes her sales in the wholesale markets on credit.  Luz is very grateful to Kiva investors for the support they are offering to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as thread, material, sponges, and more, for making bath scrubbers.

loans.name: Estrellitas Del Mar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLITAS DEL MAR” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte 
del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de papa, producción y venta de hortalizas, tienda de barrio, producción de papa y chuño, venta de ganado, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su  madre, quien le enseño la técnica de tejido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la el incremento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The community bank “Estrellitas del Mar” (starfish) begins its first cycle at Pro Mujer (For Women) as part Centro Focal de Achacachi (Achacachi Focal Center). The community bank is composed of eight members and is headed by a board where Juana is the President. Businesses that the community association members seek to get ahead are varied, among them are: potato production and sales, production and sales of vegetables, neighborhood store, and potato starch and production, sale of livestock, and blanket weaving.

The loan they will take out will benefit small microenterprises where Juana is a member.  She indicates that this is the first time that she is a member of Pro Mujer and that she received an invitation from a promoter of the institution who went to visit her home. 

Currently, she has a blanket weaving business; she learned this business from her mother, who taught her the art of weaving.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase capital (purchase of wool) to purchase from the fairs of the city of El Alto. Then she will make the production in her retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to maintain, as much as possible, her home since she is married and has three children.
When you ask what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes health training and credit.

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of criminals, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions and it is over populated. But the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, there is the option of traveling, it contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia, and lower cost of food.

Annie is 42 years old and married with five children aged between 2 and 25 years old who are in school and live at home.  For the past four years, she has been operating a table market right in front of her house where she sells soap, sardines, body cream and many more items.  She started this business with money from her mother and learned this way of selling from her aunty.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, sardines, body cream, etc., for her business.  Her plan is to move from a table business to a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, sardines, body cream, etc., for her business

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Con el crédito que obtuvo el año pasado por parte de Kiva Guillermo hizo labores de limpieza en su finca y pudo resembrar una parte que tenía planta en mal estado. Con esto podrá aumentar su producción en un periodo de dos años. Para esta cosecha Guillermo solicita nuevamente un crédito pues necesita comprar fertilizantes y limpiar nuevamente su finca.
texts.en: With the loan that he got from Kiva last year, Guillermo did cleaning work on his land and was able to replant an area that had poorly flourishing plants. With this loan, he will be able to increase his production over a two-year period. For this harvest, Guillermo is again requesting a loan, because he needs to purchase fertilizer and clean up his land again.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and clean his land.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 41-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of 7 children: her 3 daughters stay at home and help their mother in daily routine work, her 2 sons are so young, and 2 sons are studying in the school.

She has to face a lot of problems to feed all of her children in a day and to fulfill all the household expenses due to low income. In fact, her husband is the only single earning person who has to afford all the household expenses through a single source of income, which is the computer accessories shop. He sells computer accessories such as mice, keyboards, monitors, sound cards, graphics cards, pen drives, etc. It is a challenge for him to sell his products in the market where there is a lot of competition.

With the gradual increase in the household expenses, he wants to grow his income as well. Therefore, Rubina requested a loan of 35,000 PKR from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy more computer accessories for his shop. Rubina hopes that this loan will prove a productive one for the business and for her family also. 

Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories to sell

loans.name: Reyad

texts.en:
Reyad is a 45-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin City. He is a father of six children: three sons and three daughters. Reyad works as a teacher in a local school. Reyad also works as a farmer, which is his family job. They own agricultural land. They plant some seasonal crops and then sell them in the local market. 

Reyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to complete building his new home by buying stones and cement. By applying for this loan, Reyad and his family will be able to live in their new home with better living conditions. 

Reyad appears in the photo in front of his home.

loans.use: to buy stones and cement for building his new home

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: La cosecha pasada Alberto renovó parte de su cultivo de café gracias a un crédito que obtuvo de Kiva, pues le fue posible comprar planta de café y fertilizante orgánico. En un lapso de dos años él estará cosechando los primeros frutos de este trabajo que ha venido realizando. Para esta nueva cosecha Alberto quiere continuar renovando otras partes de su cafetal así como fertilizar lo que ya tiene sembrado. Para poder hacer todo esto necesita nuevamente de un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha que es cuando cuenta con más recursos.
texts.en: Last harvest Alberto renewed part of his coffee crop thanks to a loan he got from Kiva, as it made it possible for him to buy coffee plants and organic fertilizer. In two years time he will be harvesting the first fruits of the work he has done. For this harvest Alberto wants to continue replanting other parts of his plantation as well as fertilizing what he has already planted. In order to achieve all this he is requesting another loan which he will pay at the end of this harvest, as that is the time when he has the most resources.

loans.use: to renovate his plantation and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 39 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Pompeyo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de bebidas a base de maca con leche, acompañado de panes que las personas consumen como cena. Este trabajo lo realiza después de una larga jornada, pues también trabaja en limpieza pública en la gobernación de su localidad toda la noche hasta el amanecer. Según comenta le va muy bien en su negocio, pues su casa se ubica en una zona comercial y su trabajo lo realiza en la puerta, ya tiene muchos años dedicándose a esto y ya las personas esperan con ansias su salida. Ahora desea comprar maca por cantidad pues en los próximos meses subirá el precio y quiere aprovechar. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Norma, invertirá los S/.400 soles en la compra de azúcar y maca al por mayor.
texts.en:
Norma is a 39-year-old, hard workingwoman. She lives with her husband Pompey and her two sons in a rented house. She is a hard workingwoman. The economic activity to which she is devoted is selling maca (root vegetable)-based beverages with milk, accompanied by bread that people eat for dinner. This work is done after a long day since she also works in public sanitation for her local governance through the night until dawn. 

According to her she is doing very well in her business, because her home is located in a commercial area and her work is done at the door. She has done this work for many years and already people are looking forward to her retirement. Now she wants to buy maca since in the coming months the price will increase and she wants to take advantage now. This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support received to move forward. She promises to be timely with her payments. Norma will invest the 400 soles to buy wholesale sugar and maca.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale sugar and maca

loans.name: Vida Y Verdad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIDA Y VERDAD”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celeste es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos variados, venta de licores, manejo de minibuses, taller de costura, venta de ropa, costura de polleras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celeste es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de lanas; este negocio lo emprendió con un pequeño ahorro que cuando le ayudaba a su madre, posteriormente decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The "Vida y Verdad" (Life and Truth) communal bank will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office. It is composed of 8 members and is led by a governing board, of which Señora Celeste is President. The businesses run by the members of the communal bank are varied, and include: selling various products, selling liquor, driving minibuses, tailoring, selling clothing, and sewing traditional skirts. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit microentrepreneurs like Señora Celeste. She says that she became a member of Pro Mujer two years ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who was a member. Today, she has a business selling wool. She started the business with the small amount of money she saved while helping her mother; later, she decided to start her own business. 

The loan she will now take out is to increase the capital (purchase of wool) that she will get from the markets in the city of El Alto and then sell in her shop. This work permits her to generate income to maintain her household as well as possible, as she lives with a partner and has a daughter. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training.

loans.use: to purchase wool

loans.name: Darvin Emir

texts.es: Darvin  tiene 32 años  de edad y  vive en casa propia con su hija de 8 años quien estudia actualmente,  él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo  desde hace  10  años cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializa en los alrededores de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Darvin está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas para sus cultivos, etc.  Para seguir con la siembra  y poderle dar a su hija  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Darvin is 32 years old and lives in his own house with his 8 year old daughter, who is currently in school. He has been cultivating corn and sorghum for 10 years. When his harvest is ready, he sells it around where he lives. With what he earns from the sales, he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

Darvin is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, herbicide for his crops, etc. to continue planting and provide his daughter with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Mnatsakan

texts.en:
Mnatsakan is from Ararat village where he lives with his wife. This couple has been running a farm for more than 10 years. They cultivate tomatoes, haricots and greens as well as growing nut trees. As the land they own is not big, Mnatsakan and his wife have only a small harvest which they sell locally. 

Now, by applying for this loan, they would like to enlarge their farm. The loan will be used for purchasing fertilizer which is very important for successful cultivation of the land, fuel for transporting the products to the market, and they also will cover watering costs. Mnatsakan hopes that this loan will be a good step for enlarging his farm. 

Mnatsakan is very motivated to provide his wife a beautiful life and improve their living conditions. He waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, fuel and to cover watering costs

loans.name: Laylai

texts.en:
Laylai is 22 years old. She lives in Baqaa, Jordan with her family which consists of nine members. Laylai is the oldest of her six siblings. She is currently studying for a Diploma of Nursery, 2nd year. Laylai is planning to expand her studies by bridging to a university to get a Bachelor's degree. She also wants to work in her study field after graduation. 

Laylai doesn't have enough money to pay her study fees. Now she is requesting a loan to pay for her summer semester fees.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mohamamd

texts.en:
Mohamamd is 40 years and comes old from Hebron. He is married and has six children. He owns a shop selling scrap and has an experience of 20 years in that field.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to tile the floor of his scrap shop. He hopes that this loan will help him increase sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to tile the floor of his scrap shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 23 años es una hija ejemplar. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos en la casa donde nació. 
El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de ropa variada para damas , caballeros y niños, además incursionó hace poco en la venta de calzados, pues sus clientes le pedían constantemente. Comenta que una vez por semana viaja a otra ciudad a comprar las prendas de la misma fábrica por lo que los precios que brinda a sus clientes son competitivos. “Tengo muchos clientes, pues mi madre me ayuda a ofrecer a sus amistades y conocidos”, comenta. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos pues quiere abrir una tienda grande, donde sus clientes la puedan ubicar ya que actualmente se encuentra vendiendo de manera ambulatoria. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo recibido. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
María, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de ropa variada para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
María is 23 years old and an exemplary daughter. She lives with her parents and siblings in the house she was born in. Her business is selling a variety of women's, men and children's clothing. Also recently she has been trying  to sell footwear as it is something her clients always ask for. She says that she travels to another city to buy the clothes from the same factory, since the prices she can offer her customers is competitive. " I have a lot of clients as my mother helps me by introducing her friends and acquaintances to me" she states.  She wants to increase her revenues as she would like to open a large store where the customer will know where to find her. At present she sells in the streets.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the support Kiva offers. She promises to be punctual with her payments. Maria will use the 500 PEN to buy a variety of clothing for women, men and children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana, de 24 años es una hija ejemplar. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos en la casa donde nació. Rozana se dedica a la agricultura en el terreno de sus padres. Sus principales cultivos constan de maíz, habas, alverja y demás hortalizas las cuales cuida con mucho esmero durante todo el día desde las primeras horas del día. Según comenta es ahí donde aprovecha también en pastar a las vacas, cerdos y toros que tiene los que le sirven para poder comercializar a los carniceros de la zona, como también hace lo propio con los alimentos que cosecha, pero en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Ahora Roxana desea mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y ya se encuentra asesorándose con especialistas, pues desea mejorar los ingresos en su hogar. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Roxana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Roxana is a 24-year-old model child.  She lives with her parents and siblings in the house where she was born. Roxana works in agriculture on the land of her parents. Her main crops consist of corn, beans, peas and other vegetables which she takes great care throughout the day beginning in the early hours. 

She said this is also where she can take advantage to graze cows, pigs and bulls. The animals are commercialized to serve the butchers in the area. She also does the same with the food that she harvests, but in the wholesale market in the city. Roxana now want to improve the quality of her crops and she already has assessments from specialists. She wants to improve her household income. 

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support received to move forward. She agrees to pay their dues on time. Roxana will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 1 y 4 años de edad, el se dedica a la venta de yinas (sandalias) para el baño desde hace 3 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad  que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un cerdito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
This client lives in his own house with his wife and two children, aged, 1 and 4. He has been selling flip-flop sandals for the bathroom for the past 3 years. His business is located in the market near where he lives. He has many customers due to his good prices and his friendliness during business hours. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to cover some household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise to be able to better continue with his business and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase flip-flop sandals.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony was attracted to Kiva when he was told about the low interest rates. He is 43 years old and comes from the outskirts of -Rukungiri Municipality. He divorced his wife 2 years ago. He has been taking loans to finish building his house for five years.
He has now requested ugx.1,200,000 to finish the house. His tailoring business has remained stable. He is also a driver where he earns additional income. From these two jobs, he will be able to repay the loan.
He thanks the UGAFODE Microfinance Limited and Kiva lenders for giving him a loan for construction. He hopes, with this loan, the house will be completed.
In the above photo is the client (right) with the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy building materials to complete construction on his home

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en:
Abdulrahman is 19 years old and comes from Jenin. He raises animals and sells them. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more livestock.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise

loans.name: Noora

texts.en:
Noora was born in 1968. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Noora has been working at selling foodstuffs for four years. She started her project by selling foodstuffs at her house four years ago. Then she expanded her project by opening her own mini market. 

Noora is seeking a loan to expand her mini market to earn better income to help her husband in covering their children's needs.

loans.use: To expand her mini market

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: José adrián es un señor de 46 años de edad casado con tres hijos aún bajo su cargo, con domicilio en el norte del occidente del país, su actividad económica es acerrar y vender madera, sus compras las realiza   en comarcas aledañas a su domicilio, estas son efectuadas al contado al igual que sus  ventas, también brinda servicios de acarreo de materiales de construcción como: arena, piedra, cemento, cal, bloques entre otros, el objetivo de este crédito es para capital de trabajo como: cuchillas, cerruchos, entre otros y tambien darle mantenimiento a su transporte para asi poder prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: José Adrián is a man of 48. He is married, with three children still in his care and a home in the northwest of the country. His business is cutting and selling wood. He makes his purchases in the districts near his home; his purchases, like his sales, are made for cash. He also offers services of transporting construction materials such as sand, stone, cement, lime, and blocks, among other items. The purpose of this loan is to provide working capital for things such as blades and saws, among other items, and also to maintain his vehicle to thus be able to offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase wood, blades, saws, and other items and to do maintenance on his vehicle

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is a 42-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a hawker and sells fruit in their hometown. He  goes daily to fruit markets to buy fresh fruit such as mangoes, bananas, apples, etc. He is very well-known in the community due to the freshness of his fruit. He has been selling fruit for many years; because of that, he understands the mind and demand of his clientele. 

Due to Ramadan the demand has increased and he wants to buy more fruit. In this way he would be able to fulfill the demand and can easily make more profit. Therefore, Shazia requested a loan of Rs.25,000 so that her husband would be able to buy more fruit, especially mangoes.

Shazia is representing herself as a group leader and taking the responsibility for her group members. This is Shazia's first loan; she firmly intends to pay all installments on time because she wants to take out another loan in the future. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Shazia is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fruit such as mangoes, apples, and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 30ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Dioni, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Sitan 1ère  debout à partir de la gauche compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women of the group called  Benkadi 2 are all married in traditional families. They have an average age of 30 and on average, three children. They all live in the village of Dioni, in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). They met through their rainy season agricultural activities, or though ties of neighborhood, marriage or kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

Wishing to buy tools, stock up on agricultural inputs, and pay day laborers to weed their fields, the members of the group turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second seasonal loan  Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne. 

Madame Sitan, first person standing from left to right, intends to use her loan to buy seeds, agricultural inputs in Segou and tools from local blacksmiths, and to pay young men to weed her field. Her produce is sold for cash, at the end of the rainy season, to repay her loan and in order to have cash on hand to cover her children's expenses and part of those of her extended family.

loans.use: to buy tools, seeds and agricultural inputs, and to pay day laborers to weed her field.

loans.name: Jose Abelardo

texts.es: Don José vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 y  11 años ellos estudian actualmente, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace  varios años, comercializa sus cosechas en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don José está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc.  Para seguir con su siembra y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José lives in his own home with his wife and two children, aged 14 and 11. They are in school. He has grown corn and beans for several years. He sells his crops in basic grain purchase-sale agencies. With the profits from his sales, he is able to pay for some of his household expenses. José is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc. to keep planting and be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do maintenance o his vehicle and buy replacement parts.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu appreciates Kiva and Yehu for the previous loan she received that enabled her to earn more profits that improved her living standards.

With the loan of Ksh.10,000, she wants to purchase more gallons of paraffin for her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their facilitated services.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of paraffin for her business

loans.name: Julia Elisa

texts.es: La cliente reside en la zona de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Decidió emprender en esta actividad debido a que ahora es jubilada y deseaba seguir teniendo ingresos fijos.  Trabaja por su cuenta, en diferentes horarios, de acuerdo a los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes.  Es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que ya son mayores de edad.  Quisiera a futuro poder viajar, incrementar su negocio y comprar un vehículo.  De momento, tiene la necesidad de invertir el crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio: ropa, cosméticos y otros artículos.
texts.en:
The borrower resides in the District of Orquídeas in Guayaquil. She decided to establish this business because she is now retired and wants to continue having a fixed source of income. The borrower works on her own, but on different schedules, according to the orders she receives from her customers. She is single and has two children who are already grown. In the future, she would like to travel, increase her business, and purchase a vehicle.

As of this moment, she needs to invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise for her business such as clothing, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon en la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 17 y 13  años  que estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer profesional.

Doña María es una muy buena ama de casa que se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja en su casa. Para tener un ingreso extra también vende deliciosos helados que ella misma prepara y que son muy apetecidos por sus vecinos. Ella utiliza parte del crédito para que su esposo lo use en su negocio ya que él tiene un taxi en el cual sale a realizar recorridos por toda la ciudad, el lleva más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para sus animalitos y ciertos repuestos para el taxi. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para su vida. 

Su sueño es tener muy buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank La Mocora meet every two weeks in the area of La Mocora in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place that is known for its hard-working people, who work in agriculture and in livestock raising.

Señora Maria, who is 47 years old, lives here. She is married, and from this relation she has two children, ages 17 and 13, who are in school. Her husband works as a driver.

Doña Maria is a very good housewife who raises chickens and pigs. For this, she has a little farm at her house. To have an extra income, she also sells delicious ice cream that she herself prepares and that is very much sought after by her neighbors. She will use part of the loan for her husband's business, since he has a taxi in which he goes out to make trips all through the city. He has been working in this business for more than 20 years, and with it he is raising his family.

The loan is to buy food and medicines for Doña Maria's little animals and certain parts for the taxi. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are great help for her life.

Her dream is to have very good health.

loans.use: to buy food and medicines for her animals and parts for the taxi

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine is from Arevshat village in the Ararat region. She lives with her family and works with them in agriculture. The family raises 10 pigs and 50 chickens as well as owning a plot of land where different types of fruit and vegetables are grown.  The family raises pigs and sells them in the local market. As agriculture is the only source of income for the family, Armine would like to expand it. She has applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding pigs, and to buy fertilizer and fruit. She plans to use purchased fruit to produce dried fruit that she will sell during the winter. Additional income would greatly assist Armine and her family in covering their daily costs and improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed pigs and to buy fertilizer and fruit

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is single and has six children. Only two live at home, and they are currently attending school. Helen was able to complete college before starting her business. For the past 12 years she has been busy running her table business, which sells used clothes. With the loan proceeds she will buy more used clothes for her business. She says that besides not having enough goods in her shop, she has no other problems for now. With a little money from her mother, she managed to establish her business, and she learned by seeing other businesswomen. She says that she enjoys the flows of customers and the fast buying. Her dreams are to move from a table to a shop business and to educate all her children.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Om-Shahira Group

texts.en: This group is called Om-Shahira and consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER. Hana is a 24-year-old married woman who is interested in raising her children. She suffers from a lack of money to cover household expenses. She is requesting a youth loan of 50,000 YER to buy a refrigerator. She hopes to improve her family's living standard in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to use in her house.

loans.name: Tatiana Maribel

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar vive la señorita Tatiana, tiene 31 años  de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres, ella hace varios años aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en una academia en la ciudad de Portoviejo.
 
Doña Tatiana con los pocos recursos que tenia y aprovechando sus conocimientos en arreglos y belleza hace varios años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza en el cual realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. Además también en su local  vende productos y tratamientos de belleza y cosméticos. Lleva más de 10 años con su salón y le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y herramientas para el salón de belleza que aun necesita. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es tener un SPA
texts.en:
In the community of La Mocora of the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people who work in farming and cattle ranching, the members of the La Mocora communal bank meet every two weeks. 

There lives Tatiana. She is 31 years old. She is single and lives in her parents' house. Several years ago, she learned about beauty and personal grooming in an academy in the city of Portoviejo.
 
With what little resources she had and taking advantage of her knowledge of beauty and grooming, several years ago Tatiana set up a beauty salon in her house. She does different services there, such as dyeing, haircuts, manicures, and more. She works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to  8:00 p.m. and sometimes later if her customers need her services, In addition, her locale sells beauty products and treatments and cosmetics. She has been doing this for more than 10 years in her salon and it is going well for her, since she has a lot of customers. 

She is going to use this loan to buys, permanents, and tools that she still needs for the beauty salon. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help and benefits that she gets from the bank. 

Her dream is to have a Spa.

loans.use: to buy dyes, permanents and tools for the beauty salon.

loans.name: Leonor Del Transito

texts.es: Leonor  de 43 años de edad  vive en casa propia  con su esposo y su hija, es una persona muy responsable,  amable, trabajadora,   ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan francés en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 17 años, por su amabilidad ella ha logrado tener una buena clientela y de esa manera ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, Leonor ahora solicita un crédito para la compra de harina para elaborar mas pan francés para seguir con su negocio que le ha generado muy buenas ganancias y así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Leonor is 43 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their daughter. She is a very responsible, friendly, and hard-working person. For 17 years, she has been making French bread and selling it in the market that is near her place of residence. Because of her friendliness, she has succeeded in having a good clientele, and in this way she has raised her family. Leonor is now applying for a loan to buy flour wholesale to make more French bread in order to continue with her business, which has generated very good earnings for her, and thus she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale

loans.name: Karine

texts.en: Karine is from the Byuravan village of Ararat region where she lives with her son and daughter. Karine has been involved in agriculture for 10 years and mainly she cultivates tomatoes. With the earnings she gets from selling the gathered tomatoes in the local market, Karine hardly manages to pay her household expenses. Now, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy the supplies she needs, such as fertilizer, herbicide and fuel for transporting the harvest to the market. This investment will help Karine to have a good harvest and in this way obtain better profits, in order to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, herbicides and to cover transportation costs

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
María es una joven de 24 años de edad ama de casa y agricultora madre soltera de 2 hijas con un grado de escolaridad completa la cual vive con su hermano.  Ella en compañía de su hermano se dedica al cultivo, siembra de papa y hortalizas desde hace muchos años ya que fueron sus padres los que le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra y en su familia es una tradición la agricultura. Ella también se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol en tiempo frío y agradece a DIOS por tener un terreno propio en donde cultivar el cual está ubicado en frente de su casa de habitación por lo que la asistencia y mantenimiento de sus cultivos es más constante en el cual solo ella y su hermano se involucran. 

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento ya que sus planes son los de comprar semilla de papa certificada con abono y fertilizantes para dar mantenimiento a los cultivos actuales y a los que planea cultivar.

Con esta compra ella planea extender un poco más sus cultivos, ofrecer más a sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para su familia ya que sus sueños son los de poder darles a sus hijas una buena educación y una mejor vida.
texts.en:
María, 24, is a young homemaker and farmer, the single mother of two daughters.  She completed school.  She lives with her brother.

She and her brother are farmers.  They have grown potatoes and vegetables for a long time because their parents taught them to work the land, and agriculture's a tradition in their family.  She also grows corn and beans in the cold weather.

She's grateful to God that she has her own plot of land to farm.  It's located across from her house, so her maintenance is more constant.  Only she and her brother are involved.

She has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative because she's going to buy certified potato seed with soil amendments and fertilizer to maintain her current crops as well as the ones she plans to grow.

With this purchase she plans to extend her crops a little more, sell more to her customers, and generate greater income for her family.  Her dreams are to be able to give her children a good education and a better life.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seed and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Marlon José

texts.es: Marlon es un pequeño productor de café en Nicaragua. Tiene 40 años y 6 hijos en edades de 6 a 20 años. Desde hace 25 años está dedicado a la caficultura como principal actividad económica. Es parte del grupo de productores de café afiliados a la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) que están certificados por Comercio Justo. El promedio de café producido en su finca en los últimos años ha sido de 50 quintales de pergamino por manzana. Para este ciclo, Marlon está solicitando un crédito para garantizar el mantenimiento de su cafetal y tener una mejor cosecha. Su meta es incrementar los rendimientos de su café y ampliar el área de su plantación, en un corto y mediano plazo. Para ello, se ha propuesto continuar trabajando y esforzándose más para alcanzar mejores resultados.
texts.en:
Marlon is a small coffee producer from Nicaragua. He is 40 years old and has 6 children between the ages of 6 and 20. For the past 25 years, Marlon has engaged in coffee farming as his main business activity. He is part of a group of coffee producers affiliated with the Association for People in Community Action (PAC), which consists of certified Fair Trade growers. His average coffee production on his farm within the past few years has been around 50 quintals (1 quintal = 46 kg) of coffee beans in parchment for every 1.74 acres of land.

For this crop cycle, Marlon is requesting a loan so that he can secure the needed maintenance of his coffee farm and achieve a better harvest. His goal is to increase his coffee yield and expand his planting area, in both the short and medium terms. To accomplish this, he plans to continue working and investing more effort so that he can attain better results.

loans.use: to buy supplies to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de 2 de sus 6 hijos en la casa de su madre. Su deseo es mejorar su hogar para brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Su principal actividad económica es el trabajo de limpieza pública que realiza en su gobernación donde la pagan un sueldo mensual, el trabajo que realiza es durante las noches hasta el último rayo de sol, aprovecha el trabajo para reciclar y poder comercializarlos a las fabricas procesadoras y de esa manera obtiene un ingreso adicional, “a las personas no les gusta reciclar por lo que hay mucho material cuando realizo la limpieza”, afirma. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo recibido. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Olimpia, invertirá los S/.800 soles en el mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su casa comprando cemento y ladrillos.
texts.en:
Olimpia, 46, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with two of her six children in her mother's house.  She wants to improve her home to give her children a better quality of life.

Her main economic activity is her job cleaning for the government, for which she's paid a monthly salary.  She works at night until the sun sets.  She makes the most of her job to recycle and be able to sell to the processing factories, from which she earns an additional income.  "People don't like to recycle, so there's a lot of material when I do the cleaning," she says.

This is her first Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the support received.  She also promises to be punctual with her payments.

Olimpia will invest the 800 soles [PEN] in cement and bricks to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma de 30 años es una madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos a quienes cuida en su casa propia. Vilma se dedica a la agricultura. Desde los 17 años ya trabajaba en terrenos de sus padres. Ahora que tiene 2 hijos se hace cargo de 2 parcelas que sus padres le heredarón. Ella cultiva papas, arvejas, maíz y flores de gladiolos, siendo estos productos los más rentables, por su baja inversión y por la demanda, según menciona.
“El trabajo es cansado, especialmente en las siembras y cosechas, por eso contrato personal y les pago por cada día”, dice. Este año sus principales productos fueron las papas y arvejas, pero está vez quiere extender sus cultivos de maíz y gladiolos, por eso requiere de su ayuda para adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico. Éste es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Vilma, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Vilma, who is 30 years old, is a single mother. She has two children whom she cares for in her own house. Vilma works in agriculture.  From the age of 17 she worked on her parents' land. Now that she has two children, she takes care of two parcels that her parents bequeathed her. She grows potatoes, peas, corn, and gladiolus flowers, since these are the most profitable products, because of their low [initial] investment and the demand for them, as she mentions.

"The work is tiring, especially during the planting and the harvest, and for this reason I hire workers and pay them for each day," she says. This year her principal products were potatoes and peas, but this time she wants to extend her plantings of corn and gladiolas, and for this she needs your help to acquire bags of organic compost. This is her second Kiva loan, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives in order to advance. 
Furthermore, she promises to make her payments punctually. Vilma will invest the 1500 PEN in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic compost

loans.name: Marjorie Alexandra

texts.es: La cliente reside en el sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Desde siempre le ha gustado el negocio de las ventas y un año atrás empezó con esta actividad, que le ha resultado productiva y además le ha facilitado tiempo para poder atender a su hijo.  Su esposo le ayuda en diferentes horarios cuando realiza sus ventas.  Él se desempeña como guardia de seguridad en una compañía.  Tienen un hijo que es menor de edad.  Desea en un futuro comprar una casa, incrementar sus ventas y adquirir un vehículo.  Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería (ropa) para su negocio.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in the Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil. She has always enjoyed the retail business, so she started in this line of work a year ago. She has achieved productive results and her business also enables her to make time to look after her child. Her husband helps out on different schedules whenever there are sales to be made. He works for a company as a security guard. They have a young son.

In the future, the borrower would like to buy a house, increase her sales, and acquire a vehicle. She needs this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise (clothes) for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en: Mazen, from Tulkarem, is 29 years old. He owns a chicken coop and has been raising chickens since 2010. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more poultry and develop the space of his chicken coop. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more poultry and develop the space of his chicken coop.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de  40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 9 y 15 años de edad , Maria es una mujer  trabajadora, responsable, amable,  ella ha logrado ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes por  la variedad de producto que vende como: aceites, bebidas, granos básicos, salsa de tomates, margarinas, golosinas,  entre otros con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas es como ella ha logrado satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, ella quiere  acrecentar su negocio pero no posee de suficiente  capital para poder realizarlo por eso está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas productos por mayor y así aumentar sus ganancias y poder ofrecer a su hogar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children, aged 9 and 15. Maria is a hard-working, responsible, and kind woman. She has managed to become preferred by her customers because of the variety of products that she sells, such as oils, drinks, basic grains, tomato salsa, margarine, sweets, among others. She has been able to attend to her household's needs with the profits she has made in her business. She wants to grow her business, but she lacks sufficient capital to do so. She is seeking a loan mainly to buy more products, which is how she will be able to increase her profits and be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products like oils, drinks, basic grains, tomato salsa, margarine, and sweets, mainly.

loans.name: Mazingira-1B Group

texts.en:
Athumani, who is in his early 20s, is single. For three years now, Athumani has been running a video, music CD library and selling airtime. He starts working at 8 am and works to 10 pm daily and is able to make a fair return per month. 

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loan, all of which he paid back successfully, he increased more video CDs in his library. With the business profit received, he managed to cover his home expenses and plough some back into the business. He will use this loan to start offering telephone money transfer services through Tigo Pesa.  

Athumani dreams that one day he will be able to own a video production company. He will share this loan with his loan group "Mazingira-1b" which totals seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start offering telephone money transfer services through Tigo Pesa.

loans.name: Nicolas De Bari

texts.es: Nicolás tiene 30 años vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos  de 14 y 2 años de edad, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y sorgo  desde hace 5 años comercializa sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Nicolás está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas para sus cultivos, etc.  Para seguir con la siembra  y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nicolás is 30 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and their two children who are 14 and two years old. He has farmed corn and sorghum for five years. He sells his products in the markets near his home. With the revenues he gets from his sales, he pays for some household expenses. Nicolas is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides, etc. for his farming to continue planting and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, compost, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 36 años, está casada con Edwin y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.
Ana se dedica a la agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas y alverja, los cuales siembra con ayuda de su esposo, quien además se dirige todas las mañanas a una localidad cercana; donde tiene pequeños sembríos. “Necesito sembrar en diferentes tierras para obtener sembríos de buena calidad”, afirma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas de lluvia, pues no necesita regar sus cultivos. Más le disgusta las plagas que llegan con esa época del año. Su principal inconveniente es la falta de capital de trabajo, ya que necesita abonar constantemente sus cultivos. Éste es su segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente contenta con el apoyo recibido además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Ana, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Ana, 36 years old, is married to Edwin and has three children whom she lives with in her own home.

Ana is a farmer. Her main crops are potatoes, broad beans, and peas, which she plants with the help of her husband, who also spends every morning at a nearby land where he has small fields. "I need to plant different lands to obtain good quality crops," Ana says. The thing that she likes most about her work are the rainy seasons so that she does not have to water her crops. What she hates most are the pests that come at this time of the year. Her main inconvenience is lack of working capital because she needs to constantly fertilize her crops. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she is happy with the support she has received. She promises to make her payments on time. Ana will use the S/. 1,000 soles to purchase organic compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: purchase organic compost.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik lives in Kajaran city where he was born.  He has lived in his native city until now, and lives together with his unemployed wife. Two children (a son and a daughter)  are already married and live separately. Rafik has a higher pedagogical education. For many years he worked as a teacher of mathematics at the local school. Today he is already a school administrator and after his work he also gives paid courses of mathematics in a guestroom in his house. He has four pupils who take courses of mathematics as they say with great pleasure and interest. Rafik is a very accurate person and he wants to improve his guestroom interior conditions in order to support his pupils' comfort and aesthetic pleasure.
 
Rafik is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to install new windows which will keep a warm temperature in the room for the pupils while studying in the winter cold season. He will spend the other part of the loan amount on the purchase of some new literature connected with his specialty.

loans.use: to install new windows in the room for the pupils and to purchase some new literature

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti appreciates her previous loan with Yehu.

Over the years, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling at the market to town dwellers and passersby. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase spices, cooking oil, firewood and dried fish for resale. She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning policies.

loans.use: to purchase spices, cooking oil, firewood and dried fish for resale

loans.name: Mario Ernesto,

texts.es: Mario de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 4 y 10 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable, trabajador y honrado, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan dulce y francés, y sale a venderlo por la colonia donde él  reside con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gasto de su hogar, Mario quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto para poder poner su panadería y trabajar más cómodo pero con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por eso esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en la compra de arena, graba, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para poder hacer una mejora a su hogar.
texts.en:
Mario is 34 years and lives in his own house with his wife and their two children, ages 4 and 10. He is a very responsible, hard-working, and honest man. He works in his own bakery, where he makes french bread and "pan dulce" [sweet bread]. He then sells his food out in the neighborhood where he lives. He has been able to use his profits to cover some of his household expenses. 

Mario wants to improve his home by building a new room to house his bakery, so he can work more comfortably. However, with what he currently makes he won't be able to make this project a reality. This is why he is seeking a loan, to invest in the purchase of sand, gravel, cement, as well as to pay for labor in order to make this improvement to his home.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, cement, as well as to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es: Don Rigoberto de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, él se dedica a realizar viajes en su camión a diferentes lugares tiene muchos clientes  por su responsabilidad a la hora de manejar y amabilidad con ellos, de esa manera logra una buena clientela, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, don Rigoberto está solicitando un crédito para compra de llantas y mantenimiento para su  vehículo con el cual ejerce sus labores  ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rigoberto, 53 years old, lives in his own home with his family. He makes trips in his truck to different places. He has many customers because he is on time to drive, and he is friendly with them. This is how he grew a good clientele. With the revenues he makes, he pays for some household expenses. Rigoberto is requesting a loan to purchase tires and do maintenance on his vehicle that he uses for his work because it is his only source of income so he is able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase tires and do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 37 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 13, 11 y 4 años de edad,  es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son: maíz y frijol.  Wilfredo desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Wilfredo, 37 years old, is a very responsible man when it comes to his household obligations. He has always been known for giving the best to his children. He currently lives with his wife and their three children who are 13, 11, and four years old. He is very hard working. He has always done his work with cheerfulness and enthusiasm. He is a farmer and plants every year basic grains for the area such as corn and beans. Wilfredo wants to grow his sales, and this is why he visited the offices of Kiva partner Integral to request a loan that will allow him to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, etc. He wants to have the requested help because he does not have other sources of income and because with this, he will continue bringing home the bacon every day without any limitations.

loans.use: purchase seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 26 years old, from Ramallah. He has owned an office for advertising and media since 2012. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy computers and printers for the office. He hopes that this loan will help him increase the scope of work and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy computers and printers for the office.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very hardworking Kenyan woman who possesses a fish selling business in Tiribe. Her vision is to improve her living standards and to open up more businesses.

She is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase cooking oil, firewood, spices and fish for her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the loan policy.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, firewood, spices and fish for her business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Don Wilfredo de 51 años de edad vive junto a su familia; él  se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene 10 años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, él comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, don Wilfredo es un hombre dedicado a su labor, luchador siempre dispuesto a trabajar duro para alcanzar el éxito, quiere aprovechar el auge de su negocio para aumentar la producción y así poder tener mejores ganancias, necesita invertir en insumos pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc. Don Wilfredo  tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida lo que se merecen.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 51 years old. He lives with his family. He farms, specifically corn and maicillo (gamma grass). He has been in this line of work for 10 years and has gained very valuable experience that allows him to have better harvests. The land that he farms is located in an agricultural zone. He sells in all the surrounding areas and already has many steady customers. These people always prefer his product because it is of good quality and at truly affordable prices, plus, the service is unequaled. Wilfredo is a man who is dedicated to his work, a fighter always ready to work hard to reach success, who wants to enjoy the height of his business to grow production and be able to have better revenues. He needs to invest in supplies, but he needs capital, which is why he is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Integral that will allow him to purchase seeds, compost, insecticides, tools, etc. Wilfredo has good credit references, and he is sure that he will be able to pay back his debt on time. He also is confident that he will be able to give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: purchase seeds, compost, insecticides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Arshak

texts.en:
