Arshak and his nice family live in the village of Tsav in Syunik region. He is married and has two small children. Arshak, after passing his service in the frontier parts, has worked as a driver for several years. His wife works at their village school and she, in her time off from work, and her husband are engaged in farming. Arshak owns a large plot of land on which he cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, beans, different greens, etc. He also breeds farm animals; cows, sheep, chickens and bees. Since the prices are very low, they manage to sell all the harvest from their vegetable garden and farm products with great effort at the Kapan wholesale market. 

Arshak is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams as he wants to buy five bulls to enlarge the number of his farm cattle and also intends to organize hay gathering activities.

loans.use: to buy five bulls and also to organize hay gathering activities

loans.name: Albina Moncerrate

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar vive la señora Albina, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo 8 hijos pero uno falleció, los otros 7 ya son  mayores de edad, una hija  aun viven con ella. Su esposo  ya no trabaja por razones de salud.

Doña Albina para salir adelante y aun mas ya que su marido no puede trabajar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatillas por catálogos y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa. Trabaja tres días a la semana fuera de su casa y en ella todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra todas las semanas. Su mercadería  la compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual poco a poco sale adelante. 

Este crédito es para comprar ropa y zapatillas ya que tiene varios pedidos. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del banco. 

Su sueño es que su esposo mejore de su salud.
texts.en:
The members of La Mocora Communal Bank meet every two weeks in La Mocora, in Colón Parish in Portoviejo, a city known for its hardworking people who work in agriculture and ranching.

This is where Albina lives.  She's 62 years old and married.  She had eight children from this relationship but one of them died; the other seven are already adults.  One daughter still lives with her.  Her husband no longer works for health reasons.

Albina earns a living as a merchant to get ahead and because her husband can't work.  She sells clothing and shoes via catalogue.  She sells door-to-door as well as at her home.  She works three days a week outside of the house and every day at home.  She leaves her products with her customers on credit and collects every week.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.  She has had this job for six years and she's making progress little by little.

This loan is to buy clothing and shoes because she has several requests.  She's a founding member of the communal bank, which she likes because the help she receives from the bank.

Her dream is for her husband's health to improve.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is grateful for the previous loan she received from Yehu that enabled her to get profits and take care of her family.

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase wheat flour, maize, sugar, cooking oil, beans and detergent for her shop kiosk.

She thanks Kiva and Yehu for their loan policy.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize, sugar, cooking oil, beans and detergent for her shop kiosk.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith lives in Mombasa Kenya. She is 43 years of age. She has been vending juice for the past five years. She employs one person to help her run the business. She found out about Milango through friends and she has been able to secure loans that she paid back without challenges. She now seeks a loan to buy fruits, cashew nuts and groundnuts. She has recently introduced new products to her business. She has an ambition of being a wholesaler in the next five years. The challenge that she faces is weather changes and financing. The income that she raises from the business will go towards improving her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fruits wholesale

loans.name: Jivanshir

texts.en:
Jivanshir is from Kornidzor village of Syuniq region. He lives alone because his wife passed away and two daughters are married and live with their families. Jivanshir has been running his farm for 25 years with great love and pleasure. Currently the farm includes ten chickens and six calves. In the village where Jivanshir lives he has a private piece of land where haricot, potatoes and greens are cultivated. It is very difficult for Jivanshir to run the farm without his wife, as they were taking care of it with great love and care over these 25 years of hard work.

Now, Jivanshir is working hard gathering income for his daughters and grandchildren. He has requested this loan to purchase five more calves and enlarge his farming business.

loans.use: to pay for five calves

loans.name: Merlinia

texts.es:
Merlinia de 22 años es una joven trabajadora. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en un distrito rural.
Merlinia se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, hace 2 años le heredaron una parcela de terrenos, ahí siembra papas, habas, arvejas y maíz. Así empezó pero se dio cuenta que sembrar un producto es más rentable por la cantidad de la cosecha, por eso este año cultivó papas, las que vendió con éxito.Esta vez quiere sembrar maíz y flores de gladiolos porque el clima y el mes son propicios para conseguir buenos frutos y ganancias. Mientras tanto se dedica al cuidado de sus animales, de los que también obtiene ingresos; como por ejemplo de la venta de leche y quesos que elabora. Es constante en sus actividades, por lo que esta vez requiere ayuda para aumentar la calidad de la leche que produce sus animales. Éste es su segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Merlinia, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales.
texts.en:
Merlinia is 22 years old and she's an enterprising youth. She lives in her parents home located in a rural district.

Merlinia works in agriculture and the cattle industry for a living. Two years ago she inherited a plot of land. There she grows potatoes, broad beans, peas and corn. She started cultivating all at once, but she realized that growing one product was more profitable due to the amount harvested. That's why this year she grew potatoes, which she sold successfully. Now she wants to grow corn and gladiolas since the climate and the month are favorable in order to obtain a good harvest and profits. 

In the meantime she works taking care of her animals, from which she also obtains an income. For example, from selling the milk and the cheeses she prepares. Her activities are constant, which is why she needs help this time in order to improve the quality of the milk her animals produce. This is her second loan with Kiva and she's thankful for the financial support she receives to get ahead. She also commits to pay her dues in a timely fashion. Merlinia will invest the S/.1000 to purchase a balanced diet for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase a balanced diet for her animals

loans.name: Yony

texts.es: Yony nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de carne en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar más carne de cordero, res y pollo, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Yony was born in the city of Paucartambo where she still lives. She is 39 years old and she's married, as a result of this beautiful relationship she has four children. She is a hard working and enterprising mother and she helps her family get by with her efforts.

She works selling meats in one of the Paucartambo city markets. She is a responsible person, which is why she was invited to join in the communal bank "Señor de Coyllority". With this opportunity she requests the loan in order to purchase more lamb, beef and chicken meat. She's thankful for and values the loan and she commits to carrying out her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to purchase more lamb, beef and chicken meat

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa has operated a business selling Khanga (woman's wrap cloth) door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation and she dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase three bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase khangas for resale

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: El cliente vive el el sector de Orquídeas en Guayaquil.  Desde pequeño empezó a trabajar en un taller de vidrio y aluminio, desde entonces le ha parecido una actividad interesante y muy productiva.  Además le gusta la idea de poder ser él su propio jefe.  Trabaja con su ayudante todo el día en su propio taller.  Es casado y su esposa se dedica a las labores domésticas.  Todos sus hijos son mayores de edad.  En un futuro le gustaría poder viajar con su familia, visitar a sus hijos e incrementar aún más su negocio.  Por ahora requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales y herramientas para su taller.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in the Orquídeas sector of Guayaquil. At a young age, he began working at a glass and aluminum shop. Since then, he has found this line of work to be interesting and very productive. In addition, he likes the idea of being his own boss. The borrower works with an assistant every day in his own workshop. He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores. All of his children are grown. In the future, he would like to travel with his family, visit his children, and increase his business even more.

For now, the borrower is requesting a loan so that he can buy materials and tools for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Javan

texts.en:
Javan is married and blessed with two children who are still underage. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

He owns his own kiosk and his customers are passersby and neighbors. His vision is to expand his business into a wholesale shop.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase sugar, beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu has operated a tailoring business making women’s and gent's clothes for sale at home. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other tailoring operators to be her major challenge. 

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support given.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread for her business.

loans.name: Trust And Pay I Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Trust and Pay I” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.
 
Fatmata is the featured leader of this group. The 39-year-old is married to a trader and they have three children. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells palm oil, onions, margi, pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, pepper, and other items at wholesale prices

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a food vendor, which is the business she has been doing for the last six years. She is 35 years old, married and blessed with three children. Two of her children go to school. She learned about Milango through friends. She now seeks a loan to buy foodstuffs like flour, cooking oil, tea leaves and tomatoes for her food business. This business is the sole income for her and the family. She has a vision of supplying food to schools and other government institutions. The major challenge for the business is bad debts. The extra income that she will raise from the business will pay school fee for her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like flour, cooking oil, tea leaves and tomatoes

loans.name: Wema

texts.en:
Wema is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman, and he contributes in the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a coconut selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation, and she dreams of expanding to be a wholesale supplier of coconuts in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase six sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Wicklif

texts.en: Wicklif lives in Mombasa, Kenya where he does carpentry work. He is a trained carpenter and he does that for his business. He is married and blessed with four children who are all teenagers. He has been doing carpentry work for more than 10 years. He makes beds, chairs cupboards etc. He learned about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy timber for use in his work. He has an ambition of owning a sewing machine in the future. The challenge he faces is competition and the high price of timber. The extra income from the business will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is an old man aged 44 years old. He has eight children and looks after four other children in his home. All his children and dependents go to school and are depending on him for all their needs. Because of such a big family and responsibilities, he resorted to serious cattle farming and milk production. This activity has enabled him to afford to pay school fees for all the children. He is also able to cater to all the needs of his family. Through farming, he has also managed to build a semi-permanent house. He wants a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to help him clear his farm since it has become quite bushy.

loans.use: To pay for labor for clearing his farmland.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a married man with two children who go to school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. 

For the past 10 years, he has operated a hotel (a primitive restaurant) business, selling cooked food to his neighbors and passersby. He mentioned the high cost of seasonality as his major challenge. 

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil for his business.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to purchase five sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en: Edmond is a young hardworking man of 35 years. He hails from Mbarara district. He grew up without his parents after both of them died when he was very young. He was brought up by his grandmother, who also died when he was 12 years old. He was working on people’s farms where he was looking after goats. Because of his trustworthiness, he was given some goats as gifts which laid a foundation for his success. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to complete a goat pen. Edmond and his son are in the photograph.

loans.use: To complete his goat pen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail products like flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jyldyzkhan

texts.ru: Жылдызхан 53 года, замужем. Имеет двоих несовершеннолетних детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). У Жылдызхан среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Жылдызхан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2009 года занимается торговлей молочной продукции, начав этот бизнес с 30,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдызхан, она смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около5,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Жылдызхан расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдызхан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оптовой молочной продукции для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Жылдызхан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет дать достойное образование своим детям.
texts.en:
Jyldyzkhan is 53 years old and married.  She has two minor children:  one son and one daughter.  Jyldyzkhan has a high school education.  Her neighbors have very good things to say about her.  They say she is a good and hard working woman.  Since 2009 the main source of her family's income has been Jyldyzkhan's business of selling dairy products.  She started her business with 30,000 som (KGS) and thanks to her hard work, she has been able to develop her business and increase her range of products and now her business brings in about 5,000 som (KGS) per month.  This is the basis for covering her family's expenses for food and daily needs.  Her profits have also enabled her to increase her turnover.

With the goal of further developing her business, Jyldyzkhan applied to the microcredit bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) for the wholesale purchase of dairy products for her inventory.   Jyldyzkhan plans to reinvest the profits from her loan in further expanding her business and, in the future, she wants to give her children a decent education.

loans.use: to buy dairy products for resale

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхату 30 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям старшему 5 лет и младшему 1 года. Ее муж занимается предоставлением услуги маршрутной такси. Саёхат шьёт женские платья и имеет опыта в этой сфере более 5 лет. Она в течение нескольких месяцев обучилась у парикмахера и теперь хочет организовать свой бизнес и открыть салон красоты. Саёхат участвовала на тренинге «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она должна сначала отремонтировать помещение, где она хочет открыть свой салон красоты. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для ремонта помещения, чтобы открыть салон красоты. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sayohat is 30 years old.  She is married and is raising two children, the oldest of whom is 5 and the youngest is 1 year old.  Her husband drives a fixed-route taxi.  Sayohat sews women's dresses and has more than five years experience in this field.  For several months she interned with a hairdresser and she would like to open such a business for herself.  Sayohat took part in a course called  "Woman Entrepreneur, Get Ahead,"  which is put on by the National Association of Business Women and earned a certificate of completion.  

To start, Sayhohat has to remodel the location where she will open her business.  She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni (TJS) to pay for a remodel in order to open her own beauty salon.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to remodel a location to start a new beauty salon

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Далер умный и целеустремленный человек. Ему 18 лет. Он успешно оконочил среднюю школу. Далер с детства мечтал стать дипломатом. С такой целью он отлично учился в средней школе. Его родители не имеют высшее образование и поэтому они всегда мечтали, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование. Далер поступил в Университет Витаутас Магнус Литвы. Он поступил на специальность Международное Отношение. Он успешно сдал экзамены и теперь должен оплатить за учебный договор. Его родители очень рады за него. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2200 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Daler is a smart and goal oriented guy. He is 18 years old. He has completed secondary school successfully. Daler has been dreaming to become a diplomat since childhood. With this goal he has studies excellently in school. His parents do not have higher education and that's why they always dream for their children to get higher education. Daler has enrolled in the Vitautas Magnus University of Lithuania. He is majoring in the International relations. Daler has successfully passed all the tests and now has to pay for the tuition. His parents are very happy for him. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 2,200 USD to pay for his tuition. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 41 года. Она разведена и сама обеспечивает 3 детей. Детям Умарали 19 лет, Фаридуну 17 и Саодату 13 лет. Назира окончила ПТУ по специальности кондитер. Данное время она работает шеф- поваром в кафе. Ее сын Фаридун окончил успешно среднюю школу и поступил в Российско-Таджикский Славянский Университет по специальности Экономика. Назира должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nazira is 41 years old. She is divorced and is supporting three children by herself. Her son Umarali is nineteen, Faridun is seventeen and Saodat is thirteen years old. Nazira has graduated from a polytechnic college specializing in bakery. At this time she works as a chef cook in a cafe. Her son Faridun has successfully graduated from school and enrolled in the Russian-Tajik Slavik University majoring in Economics. Nazira has to pay for the tuition for her son, but does not have money. She is asking for a loan to pay for her son's tuition. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: William Alfredo

texts.es: William de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, él posee un taller de mecánica automotriz desde hace 12 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para llevar adelante  su negocio, tiene mucha clientela por su buen trabajo, amabilidad y responsabilidad, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, William esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar las herramientas necesarias como: aceite, lubricantes, repuestos, etc. todo por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
William is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. For the last 12 years he has had an auto repair workshop and this has given him the necessary experience to make his business a success. He has a lot of customers on account of his good work and because he is friendly and responsible. He is able to cover some of his household expenses with the profits he makes.

William is asking for a loan to buy necessary supplies wholesale such as oil, lubricants and spare parts etc. This will enable him to continue with his business and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil, lubricants, spare parts etc.

loans.name: Feliciana Francisca

texts.es: Doña Feliciana vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus seis hijos, ella se dedica  a la venta de pollos desde hace varios años en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable y  amable y por vender su producto a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Feliciana solicita un crédito para la compra de pollos por mayor  y poder seguir con su trabajo para obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Feliciana lives with her husband and six children in a house of their own. She has been selling chickens for some years now in a marketplace located close to where she lives. She has many customers, because she is hardworking, responsible and kind, and because she offers good prices. With the profits she makes, she covers some of the home expenses.

Felicia is requesting a loan to buy chickens in bulk and continue with her business, make better profits and offer her family a more stable economy.

loans.use: to buy chickens in bulk.

loans.name: La Cantera  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la parroquia Colon  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Banco Comunal La Cantera. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura y al comercio en general. Este es un grupo de 12 mujeres  que unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir y con estos créditos ir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Floricenda, tiene 45  años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y uno de 17 años, dos de ellos aun viven con ellos y estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es empleado privado.

Doña Floricenda es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sus propios medios y con el fruto de su trabajo poder solventar los gastos que generan sus estudios de sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal y Esika (perfumes, cremas, maquillajes y accesorios de damas y caballeros), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa a sus conocidos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días,  lleva más de dos años con este negocio y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, accesorios y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les ha dado el Banco.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The members of the La Cantera communal bank, situated in the area known as El Cady in the parish of Colon, city of Potoviejo, meet up every fortnight. The women earn a living in various ways such as agriculture and general commerce. The group of 12 women joined forces so they could have access to the loans provided by the Fundación Espoir and use them to carry on improving their quality of life.

One of the women in this group is Floricenda, who is 45  years old. She is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are adults and one is 17 years old. Two of them still live with their parents and are studying at college and university. Her husband is employed by a private firm.

Floricenda likes to make her own way in life and as a result of her work she is able to cover the costs of her children's studies. She sells products from Yanbal and Esika (perfumes, creams, make-up and accessories for men and women). She sells door-to-door and also sells from home to people she knows. She supplies her products on credit and collects payments every week. She has been doing this for more than 2 years and it has gone well.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, accessories and cosmetics. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because of the support the bank has given them.

Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

The small photo is of one of the members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, accessories and cosmetics.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 35 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Julián y su pequeño hijo en la casa que heredarón hace 15 años. Hace un tiempo se dedicaba a la comercialización de queso y al cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas y la crianza de sus vacas, “aún sigo en estas actividades pero con la ayuda de mis hijos y mi esposo”, afirma. Hace apenas un año abrió una pequeña tienda de comestibles en la plaza de su localidad donde vende productos comestibles de primera necesidad tales como arroz, leche, azúcar, entre otros y aprovecha en comercializar  los alimentos que siembra como también el queso que elabora, esto le ayuda a tener más clientela, por lo que le va muy bien y espera poder incrementar el capital de trabajo para poder crecer mucho más. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Irma, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de productos comestibles tales como conservas de pescado, harinas, leche, entre otros.
texts.en: Irma, 35 years old, is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband Julián and their small child in the house they inherited fifteen years ago. She used to dedicate herself exclusively to selling cheese and tending to her farmland and her cow. She still does this, but not on her own anymore, as her family helps her. Little more than a year ago, she opened a small grocery shop on her town's main square, where she sells first-necessity food products, such as rice, milk, sugar, and others. Of course, she also takes advantage of this shop to sell the produce from her farm and the cheese she churns, which helps attract more customers. Her business is prospering and she hopes to increase her working capital in order to keep growing. This is her second loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for all the financial support she receives, thanks to which she can improve her lot in life. She promises to be punctual in her repayments. Irma will use the 3,500 soles she asks for to buy food products to sell, such as tinned fish, flour, milk, and other items.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Juana Marisol

texts.es: Doña  Juana tiene  37 años de edad  y vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 18, 16 y 13 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 15 años, vende sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Juana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc.  Para seguir con su siembra y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana, 37, lives with her husband and three kids that are 18, 16 and 13 years old, all students. They all live in a house of their own. She has been growing corn and beans for fifteen years and sells her produce in nearby marketplaces. With the profits from the sales she covers some of the home expenses.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, etc. in order to continue harvesting and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña María tiene 38 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos  hijos de 12 y de 16 años, ella tiene un bazar en su lugar de residencia desde hace 19 años vende ropa, útiles escolares, accesorios de uso personal, etc. con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y la ayuda de su compañero de vida  logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña María está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como ropa, calcetines, accesorios de belleza etc. con esto lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. María is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and two children who are 12 and 16 years old. For the past 19 years she has run a shop from her home, selling clothing, school supplies, personal accessories, etc. with which she makes a living. Along with her partner's earnings, they are able to meet household expenses. 

Ms. María is applying for a loan for use in purchasing products such as clothing, socks, beauty accessories, etc. With this she hopes to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products such as clothing, socks, beauty accessories, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam appreciates the previous loans she has received from Yehu, which have enabled her improve her living standards.

She is requesting another loan of KES 10,000 to purchase sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour to enable her to run her dumplings business. She joined Yehu because of their favorable lending policies.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour to enable her to run her dumplings business.

loans.name: Yesica Del Carmen

texts.es: Yesica vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 3 y 7 años, desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de maíz, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela especialmente las señoras que venden tortillas porque vende su producto a buen precio, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Yesica está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz por quintales para seguir con su negocio ya que es un producto de mucha demanda con esto lograra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yesica lives in her own home with her life partner and her two children who are 3 and 7 years old. For the past two years she has been selling corn from her home. She has a lot of customers, especially the ladies who sell tortillas, because she offers her product at a good price. With her earnings she is able to meet some household costs. 

Yesica is applying for a loan in order to purchase corn by hundredweight in order to continue with her business, since it is a high-demand product, and with this she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by hundredweight.

loans.name: Alvina

texts.en:
Alvina has been engaged in cattle-breeding for six years. Over these years of hard work she owns a livestock business, which includes 30 chickens, 16 mother pigs and one piglet. 

The cattle-breeding business helps Alvina to sustain her family of five, including her husband, parents-in-law and two school-age sons. Her husband helps Alvina to sell the gathered meat at local markets and is very motivated to expand their farming business.

By applying for this loan Alvina wants to increase her livestock by buying five more calves. The additional income is very important for covering her family's daily costs and ensuring a better life for her sons. 

Avina awaits your support!

loans.use: to pay for five calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sodas, mineral water and yogurt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete his house.

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 3 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Dioni, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Rokiatou assise au milieu compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi 3 group are all married and living in traditional families. They average 34 years of age with two children each. They all live in the village of Dioni in the Ségou region (Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through their winter farming activities, as neighbors, and through marriage and relatives in the village. They farm groundnut, millet and rice. With the aim of buying small materials, getting supplies of fertlizers for farming and paying for labor costs for hoeing the fields, the group members became acquainted with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second seasonal loan cycle. 

Rokiatou, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy seeds and fertlizers in Ségou, small materials from local blacksmiths and to pay young people to hoe her field. She sells her farming produce for cash at the end of the winter season so that she can repay her loan and make enough money to look after her children and also part of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy small materials, seeds and fertilizers for farming, as well as to pay labor costs for hoeing the fields.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino de 35 años y vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas de 11 y 13 años ellas estudian actualmente, él posee una tienda desde hace 3 años donde vende aceite, golosinas, refrescos, salsas de tomates, granos básicos, etc.  con las ganancias que obtienen de sus ventas  logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  Faustino está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más mercadería como: granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas, aceites, agua,  etc. Y así seguir con su negocio que le deja buenas ganancias y  darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Faustino is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and his two children who are 11 and 13 years old and are currently enrolled in school. For the past three years he has owned a shop where he sells oil, sweets, soft drinks, tomato sauces, basic grains, etc. With his earnings he is able to meet some of his household costs. 

Faustino is applying for a loan in order to buy more merchandise, such as basic grains, sweets, drinks, oil, water, etc. He will thus be able to continue with his business, which gives him good earnings and helps to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, drinks, oil, water, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es: Doña Blanca tiene 42 años de edad vive sola en casa propia, tiene tres hijos que le ayudan económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela porque sus productos son de muy buena calidad y aprecios accesibles, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y la ayuda de sus hijos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Blanca está solicitando  un crédito para la compra de ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisas, ropa de niño, etc. por mayor para mejorar su negocio y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Blanca is 42 years old and lives alone in her own home. She has three children who help her economically. She sells clothing in a market near her home. She has many customers because she sells good-quality products at a fair price. With her earnings and her children’s help, she is able to meet household costs. 

Ms. Blanca is applying for a loan in order to buy clothing in bulk, such as blouses, pants, shirts, children's clothing, etc., in order to improve her business and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, children's clothing, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a permanent resident of Koranorya in the Mbarara district. He is married and has six children and three additional dependents who are his late brother's children. He grew up with a single parent, his mother. 

Being pushed by the need to support his mother, Julius started banana-farming on a small scale on the family's land that his grandmother allowed him to use. This banana plantation was used as a source of food for the family and it helped them meet all their needs. This business has grown, giving him an opportunity to support his family and dependents. 

Julius has also managed to construct a house for his family. He is requesting a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to complete his house.

loans.use: To complete his house.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Doña  Berta tiene 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida  y sus dos hijos de 3 y 16 años de edad, ella posee una sala de belleza y venta de ropa desde hace 5 años en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por ser una persona muy amable, responsable y trabajadora con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Berta solicita un crédito para la compra de ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisas, ropa de niño y accesorios para la sala de belleza como shampoo, cremas, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, etc. para seguir con su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Berta is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and her two children who are 3 and 16 years old. For the past five years she has run a beauty salon and clothing shop from her home. She has a lot of customers because she is a kind, responsible and hard-working person. With her earnings she is able to meet some of her household costs. 

Ms. Berta is applying for a loan in order to buy clothing such as blouses, pants, shirts, children's clothing and accessories for her beauty salon, such as shampoos, conditioners, hair clips, scissors, etc., in order to improve her earnings and thus improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, conditioners, hair clips, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con sus padres, su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella tiene un negocio en su lugar de residencia de venta de ropa de segunda mano desde hace vario años, tiene mucha clientela por vender a buen precio su mercadería, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante en su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para seguir con su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
This client lives in a private home with her parents, her husband and her two children. For several years she has been running a business from her home in which she sells second-hand clothing. She has many customers because she sells her merchandise at a fair price. With her earnings and with the help of her husband their family is able to get by. 

This client is applying for a loan in order to buy more clothing in bulk to continue with her business and obtain more earnings so that she can ensure better economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Piedad Santana  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal  Piedad Santana se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de  12 mujeres que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Banco Comunal que les ayudado mucho ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios y su calidad de vida ya que son gente muy humilde que vive de lo poco que ganan en sus actividades. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es  la señora Elena,  tiene 33 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 16 y 12 años, el menor vive con ella y estudia en colegio y el mayor vive con el papá.

Doña Elena  es  una mujer que le gusta salir adelante a base de su esfuerzo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  trabaja todos los días más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esa hora su hijo está en el colegio, además tiene varios clientes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus productos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de  semana. Tiene más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Ella está desde que se inicio el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos. 

Su sueño es salir adelante.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Piedad Santana meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts, which are recognized at a national and international level. It is from here that the famous straw hats “paja toquilla” come from.

This is a group of twelve women who decided to unite several years ago to form this communal bank, which has helped them a lot since with their loans they have been able to improve their small businesses and their quality of life. They are humble people and live off of the little that they earn with their business activities. They dedicate themselves to different activities such as businesses, services, and food sales, among other things.

One of the members of this group is Ms. Elena, who is 33 years old, separated, and from this relationship has two children who are 16 and 12 years old. The youngest lives with her and goes to school, while the oldest lives with their father.

Ms. Elena is a woman who likes to get ahead on the basis of her effort. She sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She sells door-to-door every day, more often than not in the mornings because this is the time in which her child is at school. She also has several customers who come to her house to buy her products on a credit basis and she collects every weekend. She has been selling these products for the past eight years, and it is going very well.

This loan will be used in the purchase of perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and jewellery. She has been with this communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because of the help that the loans have given her. 

Her dream is to get ahead.

The small photo is of a member that was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and jewellery.

loans.name: Jorge Adrian

texts.es: Don Jorge, habitante del barrio Laureles Norte una zona marginal de Managua, es un señor de familia trabajadora junto a su esposa siempre apoyándolo con su labor como estilista, tienen a cargo a tres de sus hijos los cuales están en la universidad y en la escuela secundaria, los otros ya son mayores de edad e independientes. El solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima para realizar trabajos de torno. El cual ha sido su único medio de trabajo durante años del cual ayuda a su familia para su manutención del hogar entre otros gastos de necesidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge, habitant of the neighborhood Laureles Norte, a marginal zone of Managua, is part of a hard-working family along with his wife, who is always helping out with her job as a stylist. They are currently responsible for three of their children, who are in university and secondary school. The others are all older and independent. 

He is applying for a loan in order to buy raw materials for lathe work. This has been his only job for years and has helped his family in maintaining their home and other necessary expenses.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as iron, bronze, aluminum, steel and plastic, and knives.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 4 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Dioni, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Djeneba assise au milieu des assises  compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi 4 group are all married and living in traditional families. They average 37 years of age with two children each. They all live in the village of Dioni in the Ségou region (Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through their winter farming activities, as neighbors, and through marriage and relatives in the village. They farm groundnut, millet and rice. With the aim of buying small materials, getting supplies of fertlizers for farming and paying for labor costs for hoeing the fields, the group members became acquainted with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second seasonal loan cycle. 

Djeneba, who is sitting in the middle of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy seeds and fertlizers in Ségou, small materials from local blacksmiths and to pay young people to hoe her field. She sells her farming produce for cash at the end of the winter season so that she can repay her loan and make enough money to look after her children and also part of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy small materials, seeds and farming fertilizers, as well as to pay labor costs for hoeing the fields.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 48 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, ella es una madre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de granos secos, carne y frutas, ella una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar más carne y papa, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Teofila was born in the city of Paucartambo and still lives there. She is 48 years old and lives in a civil union relationship in which she has five children. She is a hard-working mother and entrepreneur who supports her family with her work efforts. She sells dry grains, meat and fruit. She is a responsible person, which is the reason why she was invited to participate in the communal bank “Señor de Coyllority”. 

On this occasion, she would like to use a loan to buy more meat and potatoes. She is grateful for and values the loan and is committed to paying her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy meat and potatoes.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 5 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Dioni, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Sitan 1ère  femme assise à gauche compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi 5 group are all married and living in traditional families. They average 34 years of age with two children each. They all live in the village of Dioni in the Ségou region (Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through their winter farming activities, as neighbors, and through marriage and relatives in the village. They farm groundnut, millet and rice. With the aim of buying small materials, getting supplies of fertlizers for farming and paying for labor costs for hoeing the fields, the group members became acquainted with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second seasonal loan cycle. 

Sitan, who is sitting on the far left of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy seeds and fertlizers in Ségou, small materials from local blacksmiths and to pay young people to hoe her field. She sells her farming produce for cash at the end of the winter season so that she can repay her loan and make enough money to look after her children and also part of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy small materials, seeds and farming fertilizers, as well as to pay labor costs for hoeing the fields.

loans.name: Flavio Alfaro  (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Flavio Alfaro se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este Banco Comunal está integrado por 12 mujeres y 2 hombres, este es un grupo personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que al enterarse de los beneficios que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse y formar este grupo el cual les va servir de mucho para salir adelante. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la artesanía, comercio en general, entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es señora Letty, tiene 35 años, es casada y de esa relación tiene 3 hijos de 13, 10 y 6 años  que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Letty  es maestra por contrato en una escuela de la ciudad, pero además de eso ella también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de topo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque sus mejores clientes son sus compañeras de escuela y varias madres de familia ya que les da muy buenas facilidades de pago, ella lleva más de cinco años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual ah podido ayudar a su marido con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos y del hogar ya que el no gana mucho.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo.  Este es su primer ciclo y le gusta por la rapidez con que salió el crédito. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Flavio Alfaro meets every fifteen days in Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its arts and crafts that are recognized on a national and international level. It is here that the famous straw hats “paja toquilla” are made.

This communal bank has as its members twelve women and two men. This is a group of very humble and hard-working people who decided to unite when they learned of the benefits of this institution, which will help them to get by. They are all dedicated to diverse activities such as arts and crafts and general businesses, among other activities.

One of the members of this group is Ms. Letty. She is 35 years old, married, and from this relationship has three children who are 13, 10 and 6 years old and all of whom go to school. Her husband is a bricklayer.
 
Ms. Letty is contracted as a teacher in one of the city schools, but in addition she also sells all types of clothing. She sells them door-to-door, although her best customers are her co-workers and mothers from the school where she works, which makes it easier to pay. She has been selling clothing for the past five years, with which she has been able to help her husband with their children's school expenses and their household expenses because he doesn't earn very much money.

This loan will be used to buy all types of clothing. This is her first cycle and she likes it because of the quickness with which the loan was given.

Her dream is to give her children all the best that she can.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, tarros de leche, aceite y fideos, ella una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Señor de Coyllority” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Florencia was born in the city of Paucartambo and lives in the same city. She is 42 years old and has a common-law relationship from which she has four children. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother who gets her family ahead with the effort of her work. She is dedicated to selling consumable goods like, for example, bags of rice, bags of sugar, jars of milk, oil and noodles. She is a responsible person. For that reason she was invited to participate in the “Señor de Coyllority” community bank and, at this time, needs a loan to buy merchandise like, for example, bags of rice and sugar. She is thankful and values the loan and promises to make her monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like, for example, bags of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Pedro Rubén

texts.es: gracias al crédito otorgado por kiva Pedro pudo realizar el pago para cambiar la parte que le faltaba de su finca a café orgánico y de igual forma pudo pagar las labores culturales lo cual le ayudo a mantener limpia su finca, para este nuevo ciclo de créditos Pedro solicita para comprar fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayudaran acelerar el crecimiento de sus plantas y aumentar su producción también necesita comprar plantas nuevas para reforestar algunas partes de su finca que tiene plantas viejas y ya no producen mucho realizando esas actividades Pedro aumentara su producción considerablemente y como resultado tendrá mejores ganancias las cuales le ayudaran a empezar a construir su casa.
texts.en: Thanks to the loan granted by Kiva, Pedro was able to make the payment to change the part that was missing from his farm to organic coffee and at the same time could pay the workers who helped him keep his farm clean. For this new cycle of loans, Pedro is requesting one to buy organic fertilizer that will help him accelerate the growth of his plants and expand production. Also, he needs to buy new plants to reforest some parts of his farm that has old plants and no longer produces much. Doing these activities, Pedro will expand his production considerably and, as a result, he will have greater earnings which will help him start to build his house.

loans.use: to buy new plants and fertilizers to expand his production.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo en en ciclo pasado pudo pagar a los jornaleros que le ayudaron en la limpieza de su finca así como a sembrar las plantas para reforestar una parte de su finca, en esta nueva etapa de créditos Adolfo solicita para comprar fertilizantes orgánicos que le ayudaran a que sus nuevas plantas crezcan y las que estas en producción aumenten considerablemente ya que tiene la meta de aumentar su producción y en unos años que las plantas nuevas empiecen a producir se vera reflejado su esfuerzo al ver su producción en aumento.
texts.en: Adolfo, in past cycles, was able to pay workers who helped him clear his farm as well as sow plants to reforest a part of his farm. In this new phase of loans, Adolfo is requesting one to buy organic fertilizer which will help his new plants grow and those that are in production expand considerably since he has the goal of increasing production. In a few years, when the new plants begin producing, his effort will be reflected in increased production.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers that will help expand production.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 45 years old. She sells local juices and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more local juices to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more local juices to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 29 year old married man. He has one child who is 4 years old. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail shop where he sells electrical appliances. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an area with many customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more electrical appliances such as bulbs, cables and other items for resale. His business goal is to have a highly profitable business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will supply a large area. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: Buy more electrical appliances such as bulbs, cables and other items for resale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha appreciates the previous loans she has taken from Yehu that have increased her income and paid school fees for her children. She is now requesting a loan of Ksh10,000 to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar for her shop business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their loan policy that has boosted her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour and sugar for her shop business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman and has 3 children. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past nine years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby, all of whom are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and she dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the Kes 50,000 loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat, maize, beans and rice for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat, maize, beans and rice for resale.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en: Adriano lives in the Kongowea area near Mombasa in Kenya. He is 45 years old, married and blessed with two teenage children. He has been selling firewood for six years now. He knows Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy firewood for resale. He also owns a grocery store that is still catching up. The challenges that he has to deal with everyday include competition and high transportation costs. The income that is raised from the loan will go towards educating his children and making their living standards better.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Siatta

texts.en:
Siatta lives in New Kru town. She is 31 years old and unmarried. Her four children are between 14 and 2 years old, and all are in school and live at home. Siatta completed 12th grade, so she decided to keep herself busy with business by selling foodstuff like rice, oil, pepper, etc. to improve her life. She started this business with a little money from her fiancee two years ago. 

She says that fewer goods on her table is the only challenge she is faced with now. She likes her business because it is affordable. She learned this way of selling from her friends. Siatta said, "I am proud of my business because this is one of the ways I can help my children." She also said that with the loan she is going to buy more rice, oil, pepper, etc. to resell. Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil pepper, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: gracias al crédito otorgado por kiva Julio pudo aumentar su producción ya que compro fertilizantes que le ayudaron a que sus plantas produjeran mas y compro plantas nuevas las cuales uso para reforestar parte de su finca y el pago de los jornaleros que le ayudaron a sembrar sus plantas y a limpiar la finca, de nueva cuenta Julio solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes los cuales piensa emplear en estas fechas que son las mejores por ser temporada de lluvias y es donde las plantas absorben mejor los nutrientes también necesita para el pago de los jornaleros que lo ayudaran en la limpieza de su finca para que se encuentre en optimas condiciones para la próxima cosecha.
texts.en: Thanks to the loan granted by Kiva, Julio was able to expand his production since he bought fertilizers that helped his plants produce more and he bought new plants which he used to reforest a part of his farm, as well as to pay workers who helped him sow his plants and clear the farm. Julio is again requesting a loan to buy fertilizers which he intends to use at this time, which are the best for this rainy season when plants absorb nutrients better. He also needs to pay the workers who will help him clearing his farm so that it is in optimal condition for the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to help his farm produce more and to pay workers who help him clear and prune his farm.

loans.name: María Modesta

texts.es: en el ciclo  pasado y gracias al crédito de kiva  Maria pudo cambiar su café convencional a café orgánico y comprar plantas nuevas para cambiar algunas plantas viejas que tenia, en esta nueva etapa María pide un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos ya que son muy necesarios y en estas fechas de lluvias que es donde la planta absorbe todos los nutrientes de la tierra implementando el fertilizante orgánico en si finca y con la ayuda de la poda y la limpia de la misma María aumentara su producción considerablemente y con ello aumentaran también sus ganancias economicas las cuales le darán una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a su familia.
texts.en: In past cycles and thanks to the Kiva loan, Maria was able to change her conventional coffee to organic coffee and buy new plants to change some old plants that she had. In this new phase, Maria asked for a loan to buy organic fertilizers since they are very necessary in this rainy season when the plants absorb all the nutrients of the land and organic fertilizer implemented on her farm. With the help of the pruning and clearing of the farm, Maria will expand her production considerably and, with this, her economic earnings will also increase which will give a better quality of life to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to help her plants expand production.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 32 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard and her husband have been involved in cattle breeding for 15 years. They keep cows, calves and a pig. Alvard uses the gathered milk in cheese production and her husband sells it locally. In the village where they live, Alvard and her husband also own a plot of agricultural land where they cultivate greens for feeding the animals.  

Their only stable income that helps them to cover their daily costs comes from a retirement pension and their agricultural business. They have a daughter who is 24 years old and helps her parents however she can.
 
By requesting this loan, Alvard would like to increase her livestock with one more cow, which will help her to get more cheese and a higher income. This is very important for Alvard and her family to be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 9 years and 13 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a beauty salon where she does hair treatments, hair plaiting, etc. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to expand her business by adding a stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and other items. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase hair weaves, cosmetics and other items.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.en: Sylvie is 34 years old. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past seven years. She is married with four children. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a 40-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 17 years old. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells food supplements. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with many customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increase in prices. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more food supplements for resale. Her business goal is to be a distributor of supplements within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a car. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more food supplements for resale.

loans.name: Bless

texts.en:
Patricia is a young hardworking lady from Mbarara municipality. She grew up with her grandmother and all her needs were provided for by her grandmother who was a farmer. When Patricia completed senior six her grandmother could not afford to pay university fees for her, so she then dropped out of school to help her grandmother on the farm. 

Due to the fact that she was keen to take care of herself, Patricia ended up starting her own business of selling secondhand clothes and shoes. She later got a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Ugafode Microfinance which helped her business to grow. She paid off that loan very well. She is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to increase her working capital and purchase more clothes for resale. Her clothes and shoes are on demand due to the good quality that she offers.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 35-year-old married man. He has 2 children, ages 4 years and 12 years. He describes himself as resilient. He operates an electrical shop where he sells electrical spares and also detergents. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of electrical items like bulbs, cables, etc. and detergents for resale. His business goal is to have a well-established, stocked shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a piece of land. This is his first loan with SMEP TM.

loans.use: to add stock of electrical items like bulbs, cables, etc. and detergents for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be highly esteemed, creative and adventurous. He operates a tea farm where he grows tea. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area with potential and productivity and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to expand. 

He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy materials like timber, nails and iron sheets to put up a tea shop. His business goal is to expand his business and employ over 10 people within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will increase productivity and create employment. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy materials like timber, nails, iron sheets, etc. to put up a tea shop.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a permanent resident of Mbarara district. He is married and has 7 children and 2 additional dependents. He grew up with his mother. Because of the need to survive and to support his mother, he started banana farming on a small scale, on land he got from his grandfather. This banana plantation has been a blessing and has helped provide for all the family needs. It is his sole source of income. The banana farming has also given Edward enough income to construct a house for his family. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to complete his house. Edward and his wife are in the photograph.

loans.use: To complete his house.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine, a 37-year-old married mother of six children between 14 and 6 years of age, is requesting a loan to buy more more sorghum and beans to sell. She will use the new profits to buy a car to transport her foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans to sell

loans.name: Fazat

texts.en:
Fazat is a 38-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be honest and God-fearing. 

She operates a boutique where she sells clothes, handbags, shoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock. 

She will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings loan to add stock of clothes, handbags and shoes. Her business goal is to open another outlet within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and also expand her business.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes, handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 29-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 1 to 10. 

She describes herself to be focused. She operates a green grocery where she sells tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add a stock of onions, tomatoes, and other vegetables, as well as timber and nails to put up a grocery stall. 

Her business goal is to supply groceries to hotels within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM; the previous loan was successfully paid.

loans.use: to add a stock of onions, tomatoes and other vegetables, as well as timber and nails to put up a grocery stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beans and potatoes for sale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 26-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a shoe stall where she sells sandals, plastic basins and other plastic materials. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock. 

Rose will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add to her stock of sandals. Her business goal is to have a high profit making business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a supply chain of footwear.

loans.use: to add to her stock of sandals

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak is from Shirak village of Shirak region. She is a widow and raised her two daughters due to her hard work. 

Arusyak has a small but beautiful farm, which she runs with great care and love. Currently, it includes three cows, three calves and two pigs. Arusyak also owns a plot of land where she cultivates barley and potatoes. She sells the gathered harvest and dairy products to locals, and over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good-quality products. 

She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. By applying for this loan, Arusyak would like to purchase farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock.

The loan will support Arusyak to continue running her farm and will help her to gather more income. This hardworking woman with a perfect credit history behind her waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Costance

texts.en: Costance is a resident of Nyamityobora, a village in the Mbarara municipality. She got married at an early age of 17 years. She has  joined hands with her husband and got a loan from Ugafode, which they used to start up a small retail shop. This shop has grown and is able to support the family. They have also managed to build a house, and they are requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings to complete the house.

loans.use: to complete construction of the house she is building with her husband.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a widowed woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a store where she sells curtains and  bedding. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock.
