Bonifacio is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of the farm thus increasing his yield and income. In the future, Bonifacio hopes of expanding his farming venture so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is widowed, with two children. She is 51 years old and lives in Pagadian City.
   
Mercy has a sari-sari and videoke business to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to use as additional capital for her business, to buy more inventories to sell.

Mercy is a new member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she hopes to become a successful businesswoman, someday.

loans.use: to buy more inventories to sell.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elenita owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products in the local community. Elenita has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Elenita joined GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Elenita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, to purchase feed, rice and corn grits to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed, rice and corn grits to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 35 years old, married, and has 3 kids.  She lives in Gumahan Josefina, Zamboanga Del Sur.  Lucy is a new member of PMPC. 

She labors a lot with her bakery business from which she earns to support her family. She aims to become a successful woman someday and buying more raw ingredients for the bakery is a good start to expand her business with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for the bakery

loans.name: Riaalma

texts.en:
As the married parent of five children, Riaalma works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products. Riaalma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Riaalma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to educate her children.

loans.use: buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: This time, Cherry is borrowing a new loan of Php 29500 in order to buy ingredients for her bakery business. Her bakery business was previously funded though NWTF and Kiva and continues to provide Cherry and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of shampoo, noodles, coffee, detergent soap, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noodles, coffee, detergent soap, and other groceries. 

Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of shampoo, noodles, coffee, detergent soap, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a raising ducks business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig-fattening. Gemma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta works hard to support her family. Fausta is widowed and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines.

Fausta requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle. She has been in this business for three years now.

Fausta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her bicycle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a 'buy and sell' ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food and meat vending. Helen is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock like blouses, T-shirts, pants, shorts, etc. to sell.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like blouses, T-shirts, pants, shorts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fermented fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Herlyn

texts.en:
Herlyn is a married woman, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Herlyn is 22 years old and has one child who is in school.

Herlyn has a vegetables and fruit-vending business in the Philippines. Herlyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell to her customers.

Herlyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jesusa works hard to support her family.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Jesusa is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional bicycles and spare parts for her business.

Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bicycles and spare parts for her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 41 years old and married with two children.

Delia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Delia has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her agricultural business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Joji

texts.en:
Joji is 45 years old and married with one child. With her child in school, Joji works very hard to provide for them.

Joji runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Joji has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, biscuits, laundry soap, candies, soft drinks, eggs, cooking oil, etc. 

Joji would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. Julieta is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, spices, cooking oil, noodles, etc. in her general store.

Julieta has been in this business for 6 years now. In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, spices, cooking oil, noodles, etc. for her general store

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is 66 years old, married, and has seven children. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 12 years.  She earns additional income from running a general store. 

Ramona is requesting a loan from NWTF for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 58 years old and married. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. 

Lorna is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase ingredients such as rice, meat, spices, etc. for her food production business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as rice, meat, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is 44 years old, married, and has two children.

Lalaine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell to customers.

Lalaine has been in this business for 3 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lalaine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ma. Cecil

texts.en:
Ma. Cecil is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children.

Ma. Cecil is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Cecil requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Cecil has been raising pigs for twelve years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is married and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more inventory  to sell.

Magdalena has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Magdalena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 44 years old and married with four children.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from buying and selling root crops.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, eggs, noodles, etc.

Beverly has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, canned goods, milk, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 47 years old, married and has one child who is in school. 

Cecilia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Cecilia has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in establishing a business selling food from a stall in front of her house and will help her to increase her income level. 

Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy equipment and appliances for her food stall as well as furniture to accommodate her customers. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture and appliances for her food stall.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from running a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elsa is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsa has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 47 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom are in school.

Emma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Emma has been farming rice for 20 years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es: Estrella, tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y su hija, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de mercadería para abastecer de productos nuevos y variados para que los clientes tengan varias alternativas de escoger artículos para comprar, y de esta manera poderle ofreces a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos para el uso humano y todos de buena calidad. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su negocio y cumplir algunas metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Estrella is 52 years old, married, and lives with her husband and daughter, who are her greatest priority.

With this loan Estrella will buy merchandise to supply her bazaar [a store that sells products from various industries, often at a fixed price]. She will buy new and varied products so that her customers will have a wider selection of items to buy. She hopes to offer her customers a greater quantity of better quality products, including cosmetics and other personal care items. With this purchase of merchandise she hopes to improve her income and achieve some of her goals, such as improving her and her family’s quality of life.

This is the first loan that Estrella has received from the field partner. She had not previously had loans from state banks, but the field partner provided her the loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her bazaar, including cosmetics.

loans.name: Hekmat

texts.en:
Hekmat was born in 1963. She is widowed and lives with her 2 sons and 2 daughters. One of her daughters is 20 years old and is currently studying Bachelor of Nursery, and she is planning to expand her study and get a master's degree in the future. 

As Hekmat is facing financial crisis, she is asking for a loan to help her daughter pay for her study fees. Since Hekmat is a conservative woman, she chose to let her daughter appear in the picture on her behalf.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Sajeda

texts.en:
Sajeda is 21 years old. She is married and lives in Irbid-Jordan. She has one daughter, and her husband works as a driver. 

She is currently studying for a Bachelor degree in Biotechnology.  In the future, after graduation, Sajeda is planning to work in her field of study to enhance their financial situation.

As she is facing a financial crisis, she is asking for a loan to pay for her study fees.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Selling uniforms and tools for chefs and medical personnel, Felipe operates Aguilar’s Uniforms and More in his hometown of Eagle Pass, Texas. Offering more than 300 items from more than four different major brands, Felipe sells clothing for sizes extra small to 3XL.  

Offering a variety of 27 styles of aprons and 14 styles of chef pants, plus 24 styles of chef hats, Felipe is constantly changing his inventory to meet his client’s need. Though he has a wide range of supplies for chefs and cooks, the majority of his business is targeted to those in the health care industry.

Felipe sells scrubs designed by Cherokee, Dickies, Peaches, Barco and other brands. As a business owner, Felipe strives to satisfy his customers and ensures he purchases not only items that are appealing, but comfortable as his clients will be in them for long hours. 

To view all of his catalog, search his photos on his Facebook page at: www.facebook.com/pages/Aguilar-uniforms-and-more/349747971795238/.

Currently, Felipe employs one worker and does not have plans to hire anyone else; instead, he is focused on purchasing more inventory and advertising to gain more business. Looking for capital, Felipe went to the Small Business Development Center in Eagle Pass, who then encouraged Felipe to venture to nonprofit microlender, Accion Texas, Inc. for a loan.

Recently approved for $5,450, Felipe is now able to advertise and purchase more inventory than what he could’ve purchased out of pocket.

loans.use: to advertise and purchase more inventory than what he could’ve purchased out of pocket.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To send her son to study at a university for four years

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat, a rural villager from Takeo province's Tram Kok district, is 40 years old. Nat has earned a living through selling snacks for two years, while her husband is a teacher. Nat is able to save up to 4 US dollars per day from her current business after deducting expenses.	
 
This is the first-cycle loan for Nat with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. This cycle, she is applying for an education loan to cover the school fees for her son, a 20-year-old freshman in a local university. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her son to university to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Al-Wafa Group

texts.en:
Al-Wafa is a group of five women from Sana`a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 170,000 YER to buy construction supplies. 

Amany is 29 years old, married, and has three children. She has a house. Her husband did his best to accumulate money to start construction. She needs money to assist her husband to buy construction supplies to complete building their house, so she has asked for a loan of 50,000 YER. She hopes to buy land and build another house.

loans.use: to assist her husband to buy construction supplies for building a house.

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en:
Saeda was born in 1969. She is married and lives in Amman-Jordan with her husband, who is a taxi driver, and their three children. Saeda started selling fruits and vegetables four months ago. She is facing financial problems as she does not have the means to buy new merchandise for her store.

Saeda is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for her store. She hopes to increase her profit and be able to provide for the needs of her children. Since Saeda is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her store

loans.name: Abdulrhman

texts.en: Abdulrhman is a 26-year-old. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has a grocery store, where he has sold various products for more than three years. His objective is to improve his family’s standard of living and offer them better alternatives for progress. He started with a small amount to establish his own grocery store. recently, he describes his biggest business challenge as the delay of payment from his customers. So, he is asking for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products to offer to his clients. In this way, he can cover the delay of payment from his customers and thereby generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to offer to his clients.

loans.name: Nedal

texts.en: Nedal is 28 years old. She is single and lives in Mafraq-Jordan with her family, which consists of 10 members. She is currently studying Masters of Arabic Language, and she is in her 2nd year. She is planning to work in her field of study after graduation so that she can earn a good income to be able to cover her family's needs. Now she is seeking a loan to pay for her education fees.

loans.use: to pay for her education fees.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is married and has one child. A year ago she opened a small shop with $600 of her own money. She runs it to make money for her family. 

Celina is applying for a 600 USD loan to stock her shop with such things as coffee, sugar, milk, salt, soft drinks, soap, flip-flops, cigarettes and cookies. She is a hardworking woman who hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, milk, salt, soap, etc. to stock her store

loans.name: Afshan's Group

texts.en:
Afshan is a 35-year-old married woman who is a mother of four children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For the past five years, Afshan has been sewing clothes at home to support her family. Her husband drives a bus and is away for months and she has to wait for cash to meet her household expenses. Her brother lives with her to look after her family; he works sewing clothing at a garment factory and has been bringing home cloth so she can sew clothing to earn some money. Unfortunately, Afshan had sold her sewing machine to meet her household expenses.

Afshan is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan to purchase a machine to sew clothes. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings and be able to provide a quality education for her children. Afshan is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: Shamim is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of the business. For this, Shamim, as a member of two persons lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. With the help of the profit amount, he will put aside some savings amount to pay for the electricity and gas bill. Shamim hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and she has five children, all in school, She is 30 years old and she is running a kiosk in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as  Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, sagiko, beer, snacks, water, fish, books, pans, slippers and cigarettes. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. 

Amelia is living in a town near the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students. She has a house half-walled and a roof with corrugated zinc. Also in her courtyard she has chickens, goats and pigs. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, sagiko, beer, snacks, water, fish, books, pans, slippers and cigarettes

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Fernanda to improve her business. Fernanda opened her kiosk in 2005 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like shoes and socks, children's shoes, shoes for women and men. 

Fernanda is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of doing business. Fernanda is living in a town with her family. Her husband is a teacher. She is happy with this loan because it can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy shoes and socks, children's shoes, and shoes for women and men.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 38-year-old married woman residing in the town of Lahore, Pakistan. She has a husband, two daughters, and a son. 

Her husband is involved in a tailoring business in which he provides services of stitching clothes to his customers. He is very expert in his profession, and people like his stitched clothes a lot. Due to the burden of work, he is unable to complete his tasks alone, so he appointed a new worker in his shop and needs a sewing machine for the new worker.

Uzma requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy a new sewing machine for the worker. She hopes that the new worker will work efficiently, which will become the cause of increments in income and savings as well.

Uzma is very glad after taking this loan, and is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en: Irimiya is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in Kaduna.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to improve his standard of living.  Like all Babban Gona members, Irimiya has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/hectare, double the average Nigerian farmer's yearly income. His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will double his yield and incomes

loans.name: Toaiva

texts.en: Toaiva is a married woman with five children. She runs a plantation business growing and selling taro, bananas, yam, and taamu (a root vegetable grown in Samoa). She has been doing this for more than three years. She plans to use this loan to purchase a mist blower, bush knives, chemicals, fencing wire, nails, and knife sharpeners. Toaiva plans to reinvest her profits into her business and assist in her family's day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to buy mist blower, bush knives, chemicals, fencing wire, nails, and knife sharpeners

loans.name: Bartolinas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BARTOLINAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Quintina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de cosméticos, tejido de mantas, venta de tucumanas, taller de costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Quintina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías en lana y tela; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, por iniciativa propia, al aprender la técnica y con un pequeño ahorro que tiene inicio su taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana y tela) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Bartolinas” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Quintina as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling blankets, selling food, managing a neighborhood store, selling cosmetics, weaving blankets, selling “tucumanas” (Bolivian meat-filled pastries), and operating a sewing workshop.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Quintina. She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the organization. Quintina currently has a business where she makes handicrafts out of wool and fabric. She started her business several years ago through her own initiative. Upon learning her techniques, she was able to open her workshop with a small amount of savings.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool and fabric. She acquires her supplies at the fairs in the city of Alto and then uses them to make the products she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her household. Quintina is in a common-law relationship and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Quintina said that she enjoys the savings.

loans.use: to buy wool and fabric.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome es originario de la linda ciudad de Estelí conocida como el diamante de las Segovia, su estado civil es acompañado y tiene un hijo bajo su cargo en edad escolar  este señor se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora y honrada.

Su oficio es maestro de electromecánica en una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace 33 manifiesta que es una experiencia buena y que cada día lo desempeña con mucho entusiasmo y que se siente motivado por toda aquellas personas que están aprendiendo este oficio.


solicita un crédito a ceprodel  para complementar la compra de una motocicleta ya que la está necesitando para movilizarse de su casa al centro de trabajo, agradece el apoyo brindado ya que así podrá obtener su propio medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Salmone is from the beautiful city of Esteli, known as the Diamond of Segovia.  He is married and has a school-aged son whom he cares for.  This gentleman is known for being honest and hardworking.

He is an electrician teacher for an aqueduct and sewage service company.  He has been doing this since age 33, says that this has been a good experience and he does it with great enthusiasm every day and is motivated by those who are learning this trade.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy a motorcycle because he needs it to travel from home to work.  He is grateful for the support because this will allow him to obtain his own means of transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Sara Delia

texts.es:
Sara es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí  su estado civil es soltera, edad 40 años y tiene un una hija en edad escolar cursando la primaria, Sara se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y muy trabajadora.

Actualmente trabaja como obrera en una fábrica de elaboración de puro trabaja de lunes a viernes con más de once años de servicio, la función de ella es en preparar la hoja de tabaco para luego proceder a fabricar el puro que es exportado a los países Europeo y Estado unidos. Con los ingresos obtenidos por su trabajo lo destina para gasto del hogar educación de su hija.

solicita un crédito a ceprodel para la compra de un refrigerador el cual le va ser de gran utilidad para refrigera sus alimentos perecedero ya que ella sale de su casa al trabajo en hora temprana y regresa ya de noche y cansada para poder cocinar. A la misma vez agradece a kiva por este apoyo ya que de esta manera le va permitir poder resolver el trabajo del hogar.
texts.en:
Sara is from the city of Estelí, and she is single, aged 40, and has a daughter who attends primary school. Sara is a responsible and very hard-working individual.

At the moment, she works in a factory making cigars. She works from Monday to Friday, and has been there for over eleven years. Her job is to prepare the tobacco leaf for its transformation into cigars, which are exported to Europe and the United States. She uses her earnings to pay for household expenses and her daughter's education.

She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to buy a refrigerator which is going to be very useful to refrigerate her perishable food since she leaves the home early in the morning and gets back at night too tired to cook. She is grateful to Kiva for this support, because it will make her housework easier.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos y obtener las mejores cosechas su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, sus cosechas las comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, herramientas, etc. para seguir con sus cosechas y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in his own home with his wife and child. He has been farming for 10 years and has gained the necessary experience to maintain his crops and achieve a better harvest. His main crops are corn and beans. Whatever he harvests is sold in the surrounding areas of his community. The profits he generates from his sales are used to cover some of the household expenses.

The borrower is requesting a loan so that he can buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, tools, and other items so that he can continue maintaining his crops and provide a better quality of life for his family without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, tools, and other items.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en:
Catalino is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Catalino is a married man and he has six children. Catalino has been engaged in the farming business for more than 16 years now. This is his source of income.

Catalino is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these items, he will be able to improve his farm as well as his harvest. In the future, Catalino has hopes of expanding his business and making it a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hog feed and an additional piglet to grow her business.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en: Eugenio is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Eugenio is a married man and has 5 children. He has been engaged in the farming business for more than 6 years now. This is the source of his income.  Eugenio is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm as well as his harvest. In the future, Eugenio hopes of expanding his business and making it a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 42 years old and lives in Lower Pulacan, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with five children.

Lucia has a shop that sells home products, loads, coffee and softdrinks. She had this business for more than three years. She requested a loan to be used a additional inventories of softdrinks and rice for retail.

Lucia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Lucia hopes to make her store into a convenience store.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories of softdrinks and rice for retail

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 57 years old and lives in Tukuran, ZDS. She is married with 5 children.

Nida has a farm and she sells her harvested corn to the market. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan to have capital for her retailing. She will buy additional 20 bags of corn for retail. 
She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Nida hopes to expand her business into a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of corn for  retail

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a determined woman from Napolan Pagadian City.  She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. She earns a meager income from her store business. Being a member of PMPC for 3 years, she is able to promptly pay her obligations. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy more stock for her store.

In the future, she hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her "sari-sari" (variety) store

loans.name: Dondalina

texts.en:
Dondalina is a farmer from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. Dondalina is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 20 years now. 

Dondalina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm thus increasing  her yield as well as her income. 

Dondalina hopes of expanding her business and making it a successful and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 58-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. This is the source of her income. Her husband works a a carpenter. 

Lorna wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so.  Lorna is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to enhance the variety of her inventory at her store. In the future, Lorna wants to expand her store so that it will generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income. 

Lucia is asking for a loan to buy additional fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Lucia hopes of making their fishing business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Ryan Jay

texts.en:
Ryan Jay is 30 years old and married with two kids. He is from Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Ryan Jay is a fisherman who owns a business selling the fish he catches. He sells his fish at the market to his contract buyer. Ryan Jay has had his business for  years and earns 4,500 PHP each month. His wife also works to augment their income. 

Ryan Jay is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy a new fishing boat and purchase a net.  In the future, he will use the profit from his loan to provide for the needs of his family and educate his kids.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and purchase a net

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a hardworking woman.  She is 50 years old, married, has 6 children, and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines.

Conchita runs a "sari-sari" (variety) store business that earns her 6,000 PHP a month. She has requested a loan for 30,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Conchita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  Conchita hopes to save money for the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Mency

texts.en: Mency is a new member of PMPC from Nailon, Tudela, Misamis, Occidental, Philippines. She is 52 years old, married, and has 3 children. She earns a living through her farming activities which have been going on for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional farming equipment such as a tractor, a press wheel, cultivator seeders, etc. Mency desires to improve and expand her business and live a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional farming equipment such as a tractor, a press wheel, cultivator seeders, etc.

loans.name: Jasie

texts.en:
Jasie, is a new PMPC member from Larena, Siquijor. She is 29 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. The family earns a living through her husband's job.  

She is applying for a loan from PMPC to finance the renovation of their house. She will purchase materials such as gravel and sand.  In the future, Jasie hopes to improve her life with the help of this institution.

loans.use: to buy housing materials such as gravel and sand for renovations

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative under Credit Union Microfinance Innovation (CUMI) Program. She is involved in farming together with the help of her husband they cultivate the land and plant different kinds of vegetables and rice.  

Farming is their source of income to support their daily needs. She availed fifty thousand pesos (50,000 PHP) for the needs in there rice production project. She is very thankful to Paglaum MPC to trust her with a big loan. 

Evangeline has four children and all of them were married. She hopes and prays that their business will be successful and have a good harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy additional fertlizers and pesticides

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is from Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 67 years old, married, and has 4 children. Laura owns and operates a sari-sari store where she sells products in the local community. Laura has been in her business for years and earns 10,000 PHP a month.

Aside from this, she also has had a rice farm to earn a living. She needs to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her new plot of rice farm. Without hesitation, she borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC micro credit.

In 2009, Laura joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her new plot of rice farm

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc. for her general store business.

Fe has been in this business for 10 years. Fe earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en:
Genevive is 42 years old, married, and has three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Genevive is borrowing 32,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Genevive has been raising pigs for 12 years and also earns additional income from poultry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. Jenelyn is married and has an electronic shop business in the Philippines.

Jenelyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional electronic materials for her shop.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic materials for her shop

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 40 years old and married.  She works very hard to provide her family.

Jona runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, eggs, spices, etc.

Jona has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Jona would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing. Lucia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 28 years old and married, with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, spices, sugar, coffee, and cream. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, spices, sugar, coffee, and cream.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters, etc. for her business.

Luz has been in this business for 9 years. Luz earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods.

Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail polish, nail cutters, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn is 50-year-old widow.  She has 5 children, two whom are in school.  Lorlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Lorlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like milk, soap, shampoo, coffee, etc.

Lorlyn has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Lorlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like milk, soap, shampoo, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell lumber business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grain. Mary Grace is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional lumber to sell for her buy and sell lumber business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional lumber to sell

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 52 years old, married, and has four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Melva is borrowing 40,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Melva has been raising pigs for 16 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz works hard to support her family. Luz is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Luz requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, spices, bamboo sticks, etc. for her business.

Luz has been in this business for 4 years now.

Luz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, spices, bamboo sticks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ma. Glendel

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Glendel works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store and vehicle transport. Ma. Glendel is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Ma. Glendel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Yainkain

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Yainkain.  She is single and has one child, age 4, who is not going to school. She has no additional dependents that live with her. 

In 2004, Yainkain established her cosmetology business. She started doing this work after she graduated with a diploma in cosmetology. Working seven days a week and six to seven hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. 

Yainkain requires a loan in order to buy more cream,hair and gel worth Le 5,000,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits to approximately 1,000,000 SLL. Her child has started attending a pre-primary school but has not reach the pick for her salon to be transformed into a training center for young girls but fighting hard to achieving it. She still hopes to be a great business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cream,hair and gel worth Le 5,000,000

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Marilyn has been in this business for 31 years now.

Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Sheku Omar

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Sheku Omar.  He is married, and has one child who is nine years old. In 2007, Sheku Omar established his plastic rubber bowls and set pan business. He began his business because he wants to be self sustainable so that he can address his problems and needs all by him self. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Sheku Omar requires this loan in order to buy rubber bowls,rubber buckets and set of pan. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 900,000. In the future, Sheku Omar plans to expand his shop and to become a supplier. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy rubber bowls,rubber buckets and set of pan.

loans.name: Abu H

texts.en:
This is 63-year-old Abu H.  He is married and has five children aged 41, 35, 32, 7 and 2 years old. One is a school-going child. In 2003, Abu H. established his business selling assorted items - toilet soap, batteries, touch lights, toothpaste, baby clothes, powder, sugar etc. He began his business because he lost his parents at an early age. His aunt did not continue to pay his school fees so he dropped out of school. 

 He joined his aunt’s business for some years.  A friend gave him some money which he used to start his business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 786,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Abu H. requires a loan in order to buy cartons of batteries, toilet soap and bags of sugar. In the future, Abu H. plans to build a house and educate his child.  This loan will help to improve the business. 

Lack of a shop is his main challenge.  He is a hardworking and committed businessman.  He thank you for supporting business people in Sierra Leone.

loans.use: To buy cartons of batteries, toilet soap and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable stall operators in her industry.
 
Here she comes to you again for a loan to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to resell. She joined Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is a married woman with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her sister's siblings. She has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to buy bags of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Ropia

texts.en: Ropia lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 37 years old and married with five children. Four of his children go to school. The youngest is two years old and has yet to start going to school. In Mombasa he has been running a retail business for five years now. He has two employees who run the business since Ropia is employed and is not on the premises to manage it properly. In five years' time, he plans to open two more branches of his business. The main challenge that he faces is losses. He found out about Milango through friends and is now seeking a loan to buy wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour for his business. The extra income he raises will pay his children's school fees and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, and maize flour.

loans.name: Mwaboso

texts.en:
Mwaboso is married and has five children. Two of his children are in school and the rest are still underaged. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past one and a half years he has operated a motorcycle business. He faces a major challenge of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. He dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing himself.

With the loan of ksh.50,000, he wants to purchase a new motor bike. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor bike

loans.name: Sokmean's Group

texts.en: Sokmean is a mother of two children, one who is too young for schooling and one schoolchild. To deal with her daily cost of living, she farms rice whereas her husband drives a motor-taxi. The current business that she has had for six years provides her about 16,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Sokmean and her co-borrower are fifth-time borrowers. Sokmean is the group leader. Sokmean has repaid her past loan wisely to imrpove her living standard in a good pace. Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crops and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Saren, 34, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last 12 years Saren has been farming rice. The current business earns her about 14,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day to meet her family’s needs.

Saren has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is applying for another loan to buy fertilizers for farmland. She hopes this loan will enable to grow her rice paddy so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for farmland

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Age 60 years old, Mao is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. She is a mother of four children. She earns a living through farming rice and growing oranges which she had been doing for ten years. She and her husband can earn about 40,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day from the current business and are able to save about 20,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Mao has only been with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan. Mao is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to better off her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is applying for a loan of $1,200 USD to improve her business. She is married and she is running a business in the market by selling bags, short sleeves and long sleeves shirts, long pants, shorts, shoes, and slippers. She is making a good income from selling bags, short sleeves and long sleeves shirts, long pants, shorts, shoes and slippers and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

She is living in a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her store a year ago with her working capital of $600.00, and she is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people and she can improve her living conditions for the future.  She lives in a house that is very simple and also has animals like goats, pigs, and buffalo.  In addition she also has a garden which offers much food.  Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy bags, short sleeves and long sleeves shirts, long pants, shorts, shoes, and slippers

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, age 33, is a married woman. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. Her husband is working as a laborer in a firm but his earnings were so poor, she started tailoring at her home. She has been doing this for the past 5 years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. She also deals in the business of clothes sales to generate extra income. 

To help her continue the operations of her business, she has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to pay for personal expenses.

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Parveen raises her hand in the given picture.

loans.use: to buy stitching machine for sewing cloths

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia, is a 30-year-old married woman, and lives with her husband and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has a business providing passenger transportation services in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work for about 8 years. To carry out his work, he gets up very early, because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city.

Her husband enjoys his work, because he can manage his free time and have more time to spend with his family. In addition, he is able to obtain very good earnings. Now her husband feels tranquil and comfortable, because he has a regular income and has more free time. This will be her 1st loan with Kiva, and she hopes that with your cooperation her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time.

Fouzia requested a sum of 25,000 PKR so that her husband will be able to buy the body of an auto rickshaw.

Fouzia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this honor.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw body

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.ru:
Иномджон молодой, жизнерадостный  мужчина .  Он женат и  имеет 2 детей. Он  занимается  откормом скота. Его жена домохозяйка но она в свободное время помогает мужу   в развитии бизнеса. Раньше родители  Иномджона занимались этим бизнесом, теперь получив хороший опыт он сам занимается откормом скота.  От этого он имеет, молоко мясо и  не плохую прибыль.
Иномджон хочет получить кредит для покупки скота, потому что сейчас скот дешевле и хорошо содержать, так как есть везде трава и разные кормовые культуры. Он очень надеется, что Арванд  поддержит его бизнес так как многие фермеры уже получив поддержку от Арванд осуществили свои планы.
texts.en: Inomjon is a young debonair man. He has a wife and two children. He is starting to raise cattle. His wife is a homemaker but she has some free time to help her husband develop his business. Earlier, Inomjon's parents were in the business, so now he has good experience in fattening cattle. From this work he makes milk and butter which provides a good profit. Inomjon wants to get a loan to buy cattle, because now they are cheaper and will grow well, since there are many types of grasses and much to forage. He is very hopeful, that Arvand will support his business, as many farmers have already received support from Arvand and implemented business plans.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: Henry es un pequeño productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su pequeña finca donde cultiva principalmente café. Ha tenido 3 préstamos con la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) los cuales ha cancelado debidamente. La cosecha de café de Henry el último ciclo fue de 80 quintales de café pergamino. Para este ciclo, además de trabajar fuerte, él confía que con el préstamo que está solicitando para atender adecuadamente su café con insumos, fertilizantes y labores culturales, va a mejorar los rendimientos y por tanto sus ingresos. Para este pequeño productor, el abono y el foleo son clave para el desarrollo de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Henry is a small coffee producer from the northern part of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and four children on a small farm where he grows primarily coffee. Henry has received three loans from the Association for People in Community Action (PAC) and all of them were repaid on time. His coffee harvest from the last crop cycle resulted in 80 quintals (1 quintal = 46 kg) of coffee beans in parchment.

In addition to working hard during this crop cycle, Henry is confident that the loan he requested can help him provide adequate maintenance for his coffee crop. He plans to buy supplies and fertilizers, as well as pay for labor. This will improve his yield and his earnings. For this small producer, compost and foliar plant food are the keys to developing his crops.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, and pay for labor to maintain his coffee farm.

loans.name: Rechard

texts.en:
Richard is 27 years old. He is married and resides with his family in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He has a two-year old son. He has been employed as driver for a church for over a year, earning approximately $5 daily. His wife is a tailor who makes an income of $2 per day. Richard wants to be employed in an international organization. To achieve this goal, he needs to complete his degree. Therefore, Richard requests a loan of $480 to pay for his tuition fees for his third year of Management studies. 

This loan will help him pursue his studies despite the financial crisis of his family. In addition, he hopes that he will get a high paying job when he finishes his degree in order to provide a better living standard for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees for his third year of Management studies

loans.name: 1 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “1 DE ABRIL”  iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teófila es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cargadores de celulares, venta de tostados, venta de frutas, venta de pasankallas, venta de verduras, venta de jugos de naranjas, tejido de busos de lana, costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teófila es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de sus amigas de grupo que son socias una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de condimentos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió cuando ayudaba a su madre al negocio familiar posteriormente decide establecer su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de condimentos) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud.

En la fotografía no se encuentra una señora porque se fue a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “1 de Abril” (April 1st) is starting its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Teófila as its president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling reloadable mobile phone minutes, selling roasted corn, selling fruits, selling sweetened popcorn, selling vegetables, selling orange juice, knitting sweaters, and sewing.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Teófila. She says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from her friends from the group who are also members. In addition, a promoter from the organization came to her house to visit. Teófila currently has a business selling condiments. She learned about this line of work by helping her mother run the family business. Afterwards she decided to establish her own independent business.

The loan she is receiving now will increase her capital for buying condiments, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will then sell these products from her vending stall. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to sustain her family. Teófila is in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Teófila said that she enjoys the loans and the health services. In the photograph, one woman is not present because she had a doctor’s appointment.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr: Les femmes de Benkadi 2 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Moussabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt de campagne. Madame Mama 1ère  femme debout à partir de la gauche est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Moussabougou.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The women in the Benkadi 2 group are all married and live in traditional families. They have an average age of 31, and have on average two children each. The live in the village of Moussabougou in the Ségou region (Mali’s fourth-largest administrative region), and know each other through their winter agricultural businesses, and also because they are neighbors, family members, or related through marriage in the village. 

The members of this group work growing peanuts, millet and rice. In order to buy small pieces of equipment and farming inputs, as well as to pay the labor expenses involved in hoeing their fields, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second loan cycle. Mama, pictured standing on the left, is a successful farmer during the rainy season in the village of Moussabougou. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and farming inputs in Ségou, as well as small pieces of equipment from local blacksmiths. She also wants to pay local young people to hoe her field. She sells her produce for cash at the end of the rainy season, and uses her profits to repay her loan, as well as to have income to provide for her children and cover some of the needs of her family members.

loans.use: To buy small pieces of equipment, seeds and farming inputs, as well as to pay the labor expenses involved in hoeing her fields.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel es originario de Estelí conocido como el diamante de las Segovia, Miguel se caracteriza por ser una persona  responsable honrada es decir de buenos principio morales, su estado civil es acompañado y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Este es su segundo crédito y con el primero fue de gran importancia ya que realizo mejora en su vivienda. 

Actualmente se desempeña como fontanero de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace seis años su función es brindar mantenimiento a toda la tubería potable y realizar instalación de servicio a domicilio.

solicita un crédito para gastos medicos: compra de medicamento, pago de examen y tomografía ya que sufrió un accidente laboral y le he necesario comprar medicamento y realizarse exámenes medico ya que está presentando problema en la columna vertebral.

Miguel agradece por el apoyo brindado por kiva ya que de esta manera podrá resolver el problema de salud que está presentando ya que con sus ingresos es difícil resolver por que la medicina es bastante costosa.
texts.en:
Miguel is a native of Estelí, known as "The Diamond of the Segovias". Miguel is known for being a responsible, honorable person with strong morals. He has a wife and two school-aged children. This is Miguel's second loan. With his first loan, he made major improvements on his house. 

For the last six years, Miguel has worked as a plumber for a company that offers services for aqueduct and sewage systems. He does maintenance on potable water pipes and installs home systems. Miguel is requesting a loan in order to pay some medical expenses: to buy medication, pay for a medical exam, and pay for a tomography. He needs this medical treatment because of a work accident. Now, he must buy medicine and have some exams done to assess a problem with his spine. 

Miguel is grateful for this support offered by Kiva because he is able to address his medical problem. With his earnings, it is difficult to make ends meet and cover the expensive medicine.

loans.use: to pay some medical expenses:  medication, a medical exam, and a tomography.

loans.name: Lázaro Ramón

texts.es:
Lázaro es originario de la linda ciudad de Estelí el diamante de las Segovia su estado civil es acompañado su edad es 41 años y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar cursando uno la primaria y el otro la secundaria. Lázaro se identifica por ser una persona alegre trabajadora y sobre todo honrrado ya que lo ha demostrado en su tres crédito que ha trabajado con ceprodel el cual manifiesta que han sido de gran impacto en su familia por que ha venido mejorando su vivienda. Actualmente se desempeña como responsable de bodega en una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado desde hace cuatro años.

Con el nuevo financiamiento lo va destinar para la compra de materiales de construcción ladrillo arena y cemento para construir un sumidero de aguas negras ya que le he necesario mejorar los servicios higiénicos de su casa  expresa su gratitud a kiva por el apoyo brindado ya que de esta manera hace posible mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lázaro is from the beautiful city of Estelí, the diamond of the department of Segovia. He is 41, and has a partner and two school-aged children, one of whom goes to primary school, and the other secondary school. Lázaro is a friendly, hard-working and honourable person, which he has shown through his three previous loans with Ceprodel.  These have had a major impact on his family because they have helped him to improve his home. He has worked as the manager of a warehouse in a company providing water and sewage system services for four years.

He will use this new loan to buy building materials, such as bricks, sand and cement, to build a wastewater sump because he needs to improve the sanitary facilities of his home. He would like to thank Kiva for its support since it is enabling him to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as bricks, sand and cement, to build a wastewater sump.

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es: Doña María de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, es una mujer  muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar. Doña maría desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su hogar,  es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y así ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: María is 48 and lives in her own home with her family. She is a very responsible individual whose main priority is to support her family. She has a business selling tortillas, which she makes every day at midday and night. Her business is located in her home. María would really like to improve her business, since it provides her with a stable income, which allows her to support her family. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy corn and lime powder, to make more tortillas, especially at weekends when demand is high because many other tortilla stands are closed. In this way, she will be able to boost her earnings, which will in turn enable her to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime powder.

loans.name: Maria Elena
