Bebiana has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Bebiana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shavraly

texts.ru: Шавралы 65 лет, женат и имеет 4 детей. Супруга домохозяйка помогает ему по хозяйству. Они оба на пенсии, но не сидят сложав руки.  В поисках  источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1993 году Шавралы начал заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 30,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день его хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 9,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве содержит: 3 лошади, 4 дойные коровы с телятами, 60 овец. Также имеет земельный надел размером 2,40 ГА, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и многолетние травы. Дополнительно материальная помощь высылается старшим сыном, который находится на заработках в России. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шавралы обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на закупку овец. Доходы от кредита Шавралы планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Shavraly is 65 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a housewife and she helps him with his business. They are both on a pension, but they do not sit idly by. In search of a source of income for his family, Shavraly started working with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding in 1993. Having started with a sum of 30,000 som (KGS), his business currently brings in a monthly profit of around 9,000 som (KGS). His business includes three horses, four dairy cows with offspring and 60 sheep. 

Shavraly also has a plot of land of the size of 2.40 hectares, where he mainly grows beans and perennial grasses. The eldest son, who is a migrant worker in Russia, also sends additional financial aid. 

To further develop his business, Shavraly turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tuhsum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep. Shavraly plans to spend the income from the loan on increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finance her last three university classes.

loans.name: Sokhan

texts.en:
Sokhan is 50 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

For more than two years, she has been growing vegetables to sell, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband, who is joining her in the picture, helps her run the business. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They make an income of $15 per day. 

With the loan of $700 from KREDIT, Sokhan will purchase a water pump to use for her farming. In addition, a part of this money will be used to buy vegetable seeds for cultivation. This purchase will help her provide a high yield and earn more income for the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her farmland and rebuild her house to make it bigger and more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to use for her farming.

loans.name: Srey Ny

texts.en:
Srey Ny is 37 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running grocery store for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $7 each day. 

With the loan of $500, Srey Ny will be able to add more groceries to her stock. By doing so, she will generate more profit to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her store and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it bigger to provide enough space for her family.

loans.use: to add more groceries to her stock.

loans.name: Heam

texts.en: Heam is 59 years old. She is married and resides with a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her child is employed in a garment factory and earns about $4 daily. With the loan of $1200, Heam is able to purchase a water pump and fertilizer to use for rice cultivation. This purchase will help her provide a high yield of crops. In the future, she would like to expand her farmland and build a bigger house.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and fertilizer to use for rice cultivation

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en: Phanna is 32 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. In order to improve her business, Phanna is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase weaving materials to use in her business. By doing so, she would earn more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials to use in her business

loans.name: Heanh

texts.en: Heanh is 62 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Heanh is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase cows to breed and produce calves to sell. By doing so, she would be able to earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it bigger to provide enough space for the family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and produce calves to sell

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tes hijos de 17, 14 y 3 años de edad, la clienta es muy conocida en la zona donde reside por su humildad y su entrega al trabajo, nunca se ha dejado vencer y siempre ha salido adelante con sus dificultades. Con esfuerzo y dedicación posee una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, huevos, arroz entre otros, es muy dedicada a su labor y muy servicial a la hora de vender, es por eso que posee clientes que la buscan y la prefieren. Se ha visto en la necesidad de surtir un poco más la tienda debido al aumento de demanda y no tiene el capital para realizarlo, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar más productos como granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Confía en Dios de que pronto la ayuda solicitada, será otorgada, y no tendrá más preocupación que llevar el sustento diario a su hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia, 35, lives in her own house with her husband and her three children, ages 17, 14, and 3.  She's very well known in the area where she lives because of her modesty and her devotion to her job.  She has never given up and always has made progress with her problems.

With effort and dedication she has a store where she sells staples: basic grains, milk, eggs, rice, and other products.  She's very dedicated to her job and very obliging when it comes time to sell.  This is why she has customers who seek her out and prefer her.

She has seen the need to stock her store a little more because demand has increased.  She doesn't have the capital to do this, so she's requesting a loan to buy more products such as basic grains, instant food, sweets, beverages, etc.

She trusts in God that soon the help she has requested will be granted and her only worry will be the daily support of her household.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married, 36 year-old mother of three in Thika. Ann has been running a grocery shop for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 14,000 which she uses to support her family. Ann is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD after she was introduced by an existing KADET client.  She will use the loan to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, onions and cabbages in bulk for her grocery store. She will plow back the proceeds into the business. 

She hopes to educate her children to college level and secure their future.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, kale, tomatoes, onions and cabbages in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials for aquariums and a fish breeding unit for his aquarium business

loans.name: Diega

texts.en:
Diega is 49 years old and single. Diega works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell like coffee, seasonings, milk, snack foods, etc. in her general store.  Diega has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Diega aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell like coffee, seasonings, milk, snack foods, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Iwo Jima

texts.en:
Iwo Jima is 48 years old.  She is married and has one child.  Iwo Jima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like snack foods, candies, biscuits, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and other groceries in her general store.  Iwo Jima has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns additional income from buying and selling herbal medicines.

Iwo Jima aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like snack foods, candies, biscuits, noodles, sugar, cooking oil and other groceries in her general store

loans.name: Naarkul

texts.ru: Нааркул, 59 лет, замужем, имеет двух взрослых сыновей. Образование-средне-специальное. С 1982 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 9,000 сом KGS. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. Благодаря упорному труду Нааркул, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок и 5 овец. Также в наличии имеет 3,15 ГА поливной земли на которой ежегодно сажает пшеницу и ячмень. Прибыль позволила Нааркул размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нааркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Нааркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Naarkul is 59 years old, married, and has two adult children. She has specialized secondary education. Since 1982 she has worked with farming - livestock breeding and field crop cultivation - after having started this business with a sum of 9,000 som (KGS). Her husband and children help her with the business. 

Thanks to Naarkul's persistent work, she currently has a good farm: One dairy cow, one steer and five sheep. She also has 3.15 hectares of irrigated land available, on which she plants wheat and barley every year. The income allowed Naarkul to multiply the number of livestock at the far, and thereby improve the family's well-being. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Naarkul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of steers. Naarkul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and in the future she also plans to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase steers

loans.name: Tinatin

texts.ru: Тинатин 59 лет, замужем, многодетная мать имеет 6 детей (4 сына и 2 дочери). Образование-средне-специальное. На протяжении долгих лет работала в торговой сфере. После распада Союза, и потеряв работу с 1994 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 500 сом (KGS). Супруг и дети активно помогают по бизнесу. Благодаря упорному труду Тинатин, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 1 жеребенок, 2 дойные коровы, 20 овец, 10 ягнят. Также в наличии имеет земельный надел, на которой выращивает: картошку, клевер и кукурузу. Прибыль позволила Тинатин размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тинатин обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135 000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров с приплодом. Доходы от кредита Тинатин планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также улучшить материальное положение семьи.
texts.en:
Tinatin is 59 years old, married, and is the mother of as many as six children (four sons and two daughters). She has specialized secondary education. For many years, she worked in sales. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, and after having lost her job, she has since 1994 worked with farming - livestock breeding and field crop cultivation - after having started this business with a sum of 500 som (KGS). Her husband and children actively help her with the business.

Thanks to Tinatin's persistent work, she currently has a good farm: One foal, two dairy cows, 20 sheep and 10 lambs. She also has a plot of land available, on which she grows potatoes, bread and corn. The income allowed Tinatin to multiply the number of livestock in her family and at the same time increase the family's well-being. 

With an aim to further develop her business Tinatin turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a cow with offspring. Tinatin plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number livestock, and also to improve the financial situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Alix Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia, a sus 31 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 7 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Durante su vida productiva laboró en empresas y casas como empleada de oficios varios con lo cual obtenía ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Hace 3 años se le presentó la oportunidad de independizarse y con unos ahorros que tenía compró una tienda de abarrotes y víveres en general, ya que la antigua dueña se iba a vivir a otro país. Desde entonces ha luchado incansablemente para sostener su negocio y poder generar ingresos para seguir aportando al sostenimiento de su hogar. Eugenia es una mujer pujante, trabajadora y dedicada a  su familia, que son su principal motivación para  seguir avanzando en busca de mejores oportunidades. Solicita un tercer ciclo de crédito como apoyo, para invertirlo en la compra de surtido (mecato, huevos, gaseosas, galletería, productos lácteos) y realizar unas mejoras en el local (arreglar una humedad en la pared), con esto podrá darle continuidad a su negocio, tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y generar una mejor percepción de la imagen locativa, esto le ayudará a aumentar sus ventas y obtener más recursos,  con lo cual podrá hacer crecer su tienda, para que sea estable, reconocida en el sector y perdurable en el tiempo. Es así como podrá lograr darle una mejor educación y bienestar a su hijo y tener una estabilidad económica para tener un futuro próspero en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 31 years old, has a 7-year-old son and lives with her boyfriend. During her working life she has worked in companies and houses doing various functions, which allowed her to make income to support the household. Three years ago she had the opportunity to work on her own, and with some savings that she had, she bought a grocery and home goods store, as the previous owner was going to live in another country. Since then she she has strived tirelessly to keep her business going and generate income to continue helping  to support her household. 
Eugenia is a strong and hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family, which is her main motivation to continue seeking better opportunities. She is requesting a third loan to help her buy merchandise (pastries, eggs, soda, cookies, dairy products) and make some improvements to the premises (fix a wet spot on the wall). 
With this, she will be able to continue with her business, have a larger variety of products to offer her customers, and make more income, with which she will be able to grow her store and make it stable, well known in the area, and long lasting. This way she will be able to give her son a better education and well-being, and have economic stability in order to have a prosperous future with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (pastries, eggs, soda, cookies, dairy products) and make some improvements to the premises (fix a wet spot on the wall).

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es: Juan, a sus 23 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 1 año y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Su vida productiva la ha dedicado a laborar como empleado en una barbería de un amigo, donde obtuvo conocimientos y experiencia es esta labor. Hace 3 años decidió independizarse y montó su propia barbería en el barrio donde reside, aprovechando que no tiene competencia en el sector, por lo que hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien. Juan es un joven enérgico, activo, responsable y con espíritu emprendedor, siempre va buscando opciones que le permitan mejorar su nivel de vida, por esta razón solicita el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido e insumos de trabajo (gel para el cabello, lacas, tinturas, shampoo, gorras, entre otros) con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio y ofrecer productos de buena calidad a sus clientes, lo cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y a tener más ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Juan sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y adecuar el local para poner una sala de video juegos, alternando las dos actividades, esto le permitirá generar empleo para otras personas y mejorará sus ingresos para brindarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: At 23 years old, Juan is the father of a 1-year-old son and lives in a common-law marriage with his partner. He dedicated his productive life to working as an employee in a friend's barber shop, where he obtained knowledge and experience in this line of work. Three years ago he decided to become independent and opened his own barber shop in the neighborhood where he lives. He took advantage of the fact that he has no competition in the area, so up to now it has gone very well for him. Juan is an energetic, active, responsible young man with an entrepreneurial spirit. He is always looking for options that will allow him to improve his standard of living. This is why he is asking for the loan to buy stock items and work supplies (hair gel, spray, dye, shampoo, and gloves, among others) with the goal of providing better service and offering quality products to his customers, which will help him to improve his sales and have more income to provide daily sustenance to his household. Juan dreams of making his business grow and outfitting the shop to put in a video game room, alternating between the two activities. This would allow him to create employment for other people, and it would improve his income to provide his family with economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock items and work supplies (hair gel, spray, dye, shampoo, and gloves, among others)

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nélida, de 34 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos en la casa de sus padres.
Se caracteriza por tener un semblante fuerte, ello lo demuestra en su trabajo, pues como buena mujer dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo en la agricultura. Oficio que aprendió desde muy pequeña, y que en la actualidad aprovecha para poder generar ingresos para su familia. Todavía no tiene una pareja ni hijos, “estar al lado de mis hermanos y padres me hace sentir feliz”, comenta. Sus principales sembríos constan de maíz y papa. Lo que comercializa a otras ciudades del país. Como toda mujer entusiasta, ahora desea incrementar sus ganancias y además está ahorrando dinero para poder comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, ya que no cuenta con unos propios. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, donde se siente desarrollada y feliz, ya que espera obtener el préstamo para continuar con sus objetivos. Nélida, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Nélida, 34, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her parents and her siblings in her parents' house. She is characterized as having a strong persona, which she demonstrates through her work. Like a good woman, she dedicates her time and efforts to agriculture, which she learned about from a very young age. She now takes advantage of this knowledge to earn an income for her family. She still does not have a partner or children. "Being around my siblings and parents makes me happy," she says. Her main crops are corn and potatoes, which she sells in other cities in the country. 

As an enthusiastic woman, she now wishes to increase her earnings. She is also saving up to buy her own farmland, because she does not have her own. This is her second Kiva loan. She feels that she has developed and she is happy with Kiva. She would like to have this loan to continue with her goals. Nélida will invest these 500 Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub, a father of two from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He also runs a motorcycle transport business as his secondary business. He is married to Jane, who helps him in farming. He earns a monthly income of KES 11,000, which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his first loan term with KADET. With the loan he has applied for from KADET LTD, he will be able to purchase poultry feed and purchase one-day-old chicks for rearing. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family. 

In the future, Ayub would like to build a permanent store to keep his cereals and other grains and also buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He hopes to save money to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and one-day-old chicks for rearing.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a married mother of five from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family. This marks her third loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loans successfully. 

With the loan she has applied for from KADET LTD, she will be able to purchase poultry feed, animal feed, seedlings and fertilizers. The additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family and to reinvest the remaining amount in her business. 

In the future, Mary would like to expand her farming land. She hopes to save money to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed, animal feed, seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 38 years old and married with one child. He runs an electronics shop in Kangundo town, where he sells electronics and also does electronics repair. He also sells phones and phone accessories. He has been in this business for 13 years, and it has been profitable.

This being his first loan term, he plans to use the amount to buy phone spare parts and phone accessories for selling. These include screen-savers, phone covers, batteries and chargers. He hopes to generate more income, which he will use to add more stock of electronics.

Clement hopes to grow his business and open more phone accessories shops.

loans.use: to buy phone spare parts, phone accessories, and electronics.

loans.name: Mazingira-1A Group

texts.en:
Kisra, who is in her early 40s, is married and has two sons who are in college. For four years now, Kisra has been managing her life by running a clothes shop. She is doing great in her enterprise. She works from 8 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a good profit every month. This is her 11th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use it to stock more clothes to resell. With Kisra's previous loans, all of which repaid successfully, she managed to buy more stock, which sold out. With the profit received from her business, she managed to cover her boys' tuition fees, pay her home expenses and start building a family house. Kisra dreams that one day will be able to own a big clothing shop. 

Kisra will share this loan with her loan group Mazingira-1a, which totals 8 clients. The clients of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to stock more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 55 years old, married, and mother of one daughter. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her family. For the past 10 years, she has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Fatma’s income is 140 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and she is doing it together with her husband. Fatma keeps a flock of sheep in her own yard. She fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from her. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

Fatma is applying for a loan of 1800 AZN to buy 10 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer. She is optimistic about this loan, because in the summer more people consume meat due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer.
